0.title: Hardik a changed man now, I see sense of ambition in him: Manjrekar
0.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Sanjay Manjrekar said the India all-rounder is a changed man now. "I see a sense of ambition coming into him. And once you have that, wanting to grow within Indian cricket then there's tremendous motivation," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 2-1 win in three-match ODI series against England.

1.title: Over 1,500 people killed in elephant attacks in last 3 years: Govt
1.article_body: About 1,578 people have died in elephant attacks in the country in the last three years, according to data shared by the Union Environment Ministry in Lok Sabha. Out of the total deaths reported due to elephant attacks, 585 people died in 16 states during 2019-20, 461 fatalities occurred in 2020-21 and 532 people died in 2021-22, the ministry added.

2.title: Tamil Nadu govt transfers Kallakurichi Collector, SP after violence over girl's death
2.article_body: Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday transferred Kallakurichi District Collector PN Sridhar and Superintendent of Police (SP) S Selvakumar, days after violence broke out following a Class 12 girl's death. Sravan Kumar Jatavath has been posted as the new collector and P Pakalavan will take charge as the SP. The state has formed a Special Investigation Team to probe the violence.

3.title: Govt lists countries preferred by people who gave up Indian citizenship in 2021
3.article_body: Over 1.6 lakh people gave up Indian citizenship in 2021, the Union Ministry of Home Affairs' data released on Tuesday said. The US was the most-preferred country by such people, followed by Australia, Canada and the UK. Italy, New Zealand, Singapore, Germany, the Netherlands and Sweden were also among the top 10 nations where expats renounced Indian citizenship in 2021.

4.title: Star Sports bags Cricket Australia media rights for next 4-yr cycle: Reports
4.article_body: Star Sports has reportedly bagged the media rights to broadcast Australian cricket in India for the upcoming four-year cycle. Cricket Australia and the sports broadcaster are reported to have signed the contract, which includes a clause to extend the arrangement by an additional four years. The cycle will likely begin from the start of this year's Australian cricket season.

5.title: Will use entire police reserve if needed: Anil Vij on catching DSP's killers
5.article_body: After Tauru DSP was allegedly killed by a mining mafia in Haryana's Nuh district, state Home Minister Anil Vij said, "Every single one of them (accused) will be apprehended." "I told the DGP that a reply to this incident will be given, even if he has to use police force of the entire district, nearby districts or reserve," Vij added.

6.title: COVID-19 cases triple across Europe, hospitalisations double: WHO
6.article_body: The World Health Organization has said that COVID-19 cases have tripled across Europe in the past six weeks. "Hospitalisation rates...have doubled in the same period," it added. The 53 nations in WHO's European region reported nearly 3 million new cases last week, accounting for nearly half of all infections globally. Reportedly, Europe is seeing about 3,000 coronavirus-related deaths every week.

7.title: Seeking money for 'ailing' mom, man cheats Pune BJP MLA of ₹3,400
7.article_body: A case has been registered against a man for allegedly cheating a BJP MLA from Pune of ₹3,400 by claiming that he needed money to buy medicines for his ailing mother, police said on Tuesday. Madhuri Misal said that she received a call, following which she asked her daughter to transfer the money to the given number.

8.title: K'taka govt to oppose Centre's draft notification on ESA in Western Ghats
8.article_body: Karnataka government has decided to oppose Centre's draft notification on Ecologically Sensitive Areas (ESA) in the Western Ghats. Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said, "MLAs cutting across party lines have unanimously expressed their opposition to the notification...A delegation of Lok Sabha members and MLAs...headed by CM (Basavaraj Bommai), will meet the Union Environment Minister."

9.title: Japan fisherman stabs over 30 sea turtles to death in 'frustration'
9.article_body: A Japanese fisherman has confessed to stabbing 30-50 sea turtles to death in "frustration" after they got caught in his fishing net, officials said. The sea turtles, which are protected creatures, were found with stab wounds on their necks and other body parts on a beach on Kumejima island last week. The fisherman, who hasn't been named, expressed regret later.

10.title: No: MoS Rai as MP asks whether terror attacks are rising in India
10.article_body: After Lok Sabha MP A Ganeshamurthi asked whether incidents of terror attacks are rising in India, Union Minister of State (MoS) for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai replied, "No, Sir." The MoS said, "The security situation has improved significantly in Jammu and Kashmir...There has been a substantial decline in terrorist attacks from 417 in 2018 to 229 in 2021."

11.title: Fire breaks out at residential building in East Delhi; 12 rescued
11.article_body: A fire broke out at a four-storey residential building in East Delhi's New Ashok Nagar on Tuesday, officials said. Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said, "Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot and so far 12 people have been rescued." The fire broke out on the building's first floor and the incident's cause is being ascertained, Garg added.

12.title: Haryana CM announces ₹1 cr aid for DSP killed by mining mafia, vows strict action
12.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar announced financial assistance of ₹1 crore for the family of DSP Surender Singh, who was allegedly killed by the mining mafia in Nuh on Tuesday. Khattar also announced a government job for one of Singh's family members. The CM said he has directed authorities to take the strictest possible action against the accused.

13.title: Not nailed yet: Marnus Labuschagne on his ODI spot for 2023 World Cup
13.article_body: Marnus Labuschagne has said he's targeting to be part of Australia's squad for the 2023 ODI World Cup. He, however, also stated that he's yet to nail down a spot in the XI. "I certainly haven't been performing as well as I want to," he added. Labuschagne has played 21 ODIs, scoring 677 runs, including one century and four fifties.

14.title: Olympic champion Rojas wins third straight triple jump World C'ships gold
14.article_body: Olympic gold medallist Yulimar Rojas of Venezuela won her third consecutive triple jump gold at the World Athletics Championships after she jumped 15.47 metres in Oregon on Monday. "This is a special competition for me," said Rojas. Jamaican Shanieka Ricketts clinched her second consecutive world silver with a 14.89-metre jump, while American Tori Franklin took bronze (14.72 metres).

15.title: He was retiring this yr, has 2 kids: Brother of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid
15.article_body: The younger brother of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during an illegal mining raid, has said the officer was due for retirement this year. "I spoke with him today only," said Singh's brother Ashok Manju, adding, "He has two children." Singh was on a surprise inspection based on a tip-off, said ADG Ravi Kiran.

16.title: After Carmel Convent mishap, survey says 72 Chandigarh dry trees need felling
16.article_body: After Carmel Convent school incident in Chandigarh, a fresh survey of 204 schools has found that 72 dead and dry trees need felling. UT Adviser Dharam Pal has given a week to municipal corporation and UT Engineering and Forest Departments to cut these trees down. This comes after a student lost her life after tree fell on her in city.

17.title: 5-month pregnant woman given abortion pill by husband in UP, dies
17.article_body: A five-month pregnant woman from Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district died after her husband gave her an abortion pill. The 27-year-old woman's parents alleged that she started bleeding excessively after consuming the medicine. Her relatives then took her to a hospital where she was declared brought dead. The woman's parents have demanded action against her husband and his family.

18.title: UP man impersonates Bombay HC CJ, tries to cheat officers; held
18.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested from UP for allegedly impersonating the Chief Justice of Bombay HC Dipankar Datta and trying to cheat court officers. The police said that the accused had set Justice Datta's name and photo as a display picture on WhatsApp and sent out messages to officers demanding Amazon Pay gift cards.

19.title: Bus overturns in UP after driver tries to avoid hitting stray animal; 1 dead
19.article_body: A Kanpur-Meerut bound bus overturned near Harchandpur village in Etah, Uttar Pradesh, leading to the death of one person, Jaswant (45), and injuring 18 people, including 5 women. The bus met with an accident after the driver lost control while trying to avoid hitting the stray animal that came in front of the vehicle, police said.

20.title: B'luru woman tears down illegal hoarding wishing BJP leader on birthday
20.article_body: A woman tore down an illegal flex hoarding installed to wish BJP national general secretary CT Ravi on his birthday in front of Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru on Monday. Social media chief of Congress' Karnataka unit from Belagavi shared a video online in which the woman is seen ripping the poster. "Bindu Gowda boldly tore down the banner," he wrote.

21.title: Sri Lankans protest outside house of ex-Prez Rajapaksa's son in US
21.article_body: A group of Sri Lankan protesters gathered outside house of ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's son Manoj in Los Angeles and demanded that Rajapaksa returns to Sri Lanka. The protest that took place last week comes amid ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Gotabaya, who has resigned as President, is currently in Singapore on a "private visit", Singapore government said.

22.title: Picasso sketch worth over ₹3.6 cr seized by Spanish customs
22.article_body: Spanish customs officials at Ibiza Airport seized a Picasso sketch worth over €450,000 (over ₹3.6 crore) after a traveller failed to declare the artwork. The unnamed passenger, who arrived from Switzerland, initially attempted to pass the 1966 sketch, named Trois personnages, as a copy. But a gallery invoice discovered in his luggage appeared to identify the work as an original.

23.title: Shehnaaz Gill to join Anil, Bhumi in Rhea Kapoor's next: Reports
23.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill has reportedly signed on to star in Rhea Kapoor's next film. It'll reportedly be helmed by Rhea's husband Karan Boolani. She'll be seen sharing screen space with Anil Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar in the forthcoming project, reports said. The film is reportedly a modern take on relationships and will go on floors by the end of this month.

24.title: Delhi govt received 3,500 missed calls to volunteer as 'Paryavaran Mitra'
24.article_body: The Delhi government received 3,500 missed calls from those who want to be registered as 'Paryavaran Mitra', an official statement said on Tuesday. 'Paryavaran Mitra' is an initiative to build a network of people who can work for environmental sustainability. The volunteers will be responsible for increasing greenery, reducing pollution and improving waste management in their areas.

25.title: Body of missing 7-yr-old from Thane found, relative says family is devastated
25.article_body: Body of seven-year-old boy who had fallen in Thane creek last Wednesday has been found in Airoli. "His father used to go by the creek side every morning and wait for some news from the boats that went looking for Rishi. Rishi's mother is still hoping that he would be back healthy...the news...left...family devastated," said a relative of the family.

26.title: Two feared dead after being swept in river in Rajasthan's Pratapgarh
26.article_body: Two men are feared to be dead after they were swept by the strong currents of the Mahi Erav river in the Bawdi village of Rajasthan's Pratapgarh district. The incident happened when the two missing persons, Jeta Delia (25) and Rajeng Singh (22), along with two others were trying to cross the river, the Station House Officer (Ghantali) said.

27.title: Manushi joins John in 'Tehran', says 'This is going to be really special'
27.article_body: Manushi Chhillar has been roped in to star opposite John Abraham in the upcoming film 'Tehran'. The former Miss World, who was recently seen in Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', shared a post on Instagram announcing her next film and wrote, "Super excited to join the one & only John Abraham on #Tehran. This journey is going to be really special!"

28.title: SRK has been working to build toned physique for 4 yrs: Trainer on Pathaan
28.article_body: Discussing actor Shah Rukh Khan's toned physique for 'Pathaan', his trainer Prashant Sawant said SRK has been working towards this physique for the last four years. "Everything in diet was...measured...Despite injuries serving as a setback, he came back stronger," added Prashant. "Shah Rukh started doing a lot of [heavy lifting]...Previously, we used to do...circuit training," he stated.

29.title: Government does not maintain data of arrested journalists: MHA
29.article_body: Union Minister for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, on Tuesday, informed in a written reply in Lok Sabha that the NCRB does not maintain any specific data regarding the arrest of journalists. His remarks came after TMC MP Mala Roy had asked about the total number of journalists arrested in the country since 2019, along with the charges against them.

30.title: Funeral procession of Haryana's law & order taken out: Hooda on DSP's killing
30.article_body: Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda reacted to the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Nuh on Tuesday. "Funeral procession of Haryana's law and order has been taken out," Hooda added. "The state government has completely failed and criminals are roaming around-both mining mafia and organised gangsters. Organised crime has entered Haryana," Hooda stated.

31.title: Received proposal to change name of West Bengal to Bangla: MHA
31.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday said the Centre has received a proposal from state government to change the name of West Bengal to Bangla. "A proposal has been received from the Government of West Bengal for renaming the state as Bangla in all three languages - Bengali, English and Hindi," Union MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai, said.

32.title: Servant held for stealing gold worth ₹16 lakh from a Mumbai apartment
32.article_body: A 28-year-old servant, Chhotu Laxman Mandal, was arrested for allegedly stealing gold biscuits worth over ₹16 lakh from an apartment in Mumbai's Grant Road, police said. "The theft had taken place a week ago on July 11, when the...employer was visiting her son, who had met with an accident," police said. An FIR was registered under IPC section 381(theft).

33.title: Highways within 100 km of LoC, borders will not need green nod: Centre
33.article_body: Centre exempted highway projects related to defence and strategic importance within 100 kilometres of the Line of Control (LoC) and borders from seeking a green nod. "Such projects are sensitive in nature...need to be executed on priority keeping in view strategic...security considerations," the Centre added. It also exempted projects pertaining to the expansion of terminal buildings at airports.

34.title: KGF's Yash, wife Radhika's debut film completes 14 yrs, actress shares post
34.article_body: Actress Radhika Pandit, wife of 'KGF' actor Yash, has shared a post on Instagram celebrating 14 years of the film 'Moggina Manasu', which marked her and Yash's debut in the film industry. Sharing a few stills from the film, Radhika wrote, "This film has given me so much...A Filmfare award, State award and a life partner...couldn't have asked for more!!"

35.title: Tejashwi offered support to protect family from going to jail: Bihar BJP chief
35.article_body: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said RJD's Tejashwi Yadav was ready to support BJP in government formation in Bihar to "protect himself and his family from going to jail". His statement came after Yadav said MoS Home Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "No matter how much they try, Tejashwi and family will be jailed," Jaiswal added.

36.title: Govt putting more tax burden on people: Siddaramaiah on GST hike
36.article_body: Criticising the Central government over the latest hike of Goods and Services Tax (GST) on various essential food items, Congress leader Siddaramaiah said the government is putting more tax burden on people instead of helping them. "Depriving people of their food is 'Acche Din' for Narendra Modi-led government," Siddaramaiah tweeted. He further termed GST as 'Gabbar Singh Tax'.

37.title: KL Rahul faces Jhulan Goswami in nets at NCA, video goes viral
37.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Indian men's cricket team batter KL Rahul facing India Women pacer Jhulan Goswami in the nets at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. Rahul has started net practice days after undergoing a successful groin surgery in Germany. Rahul has been included in Team India's T20I squad for West Indies series subject to fitness.

38.title: 1 labourer dead, 18 missing near Indo-China border In Arunachal
38.article_body: One labourer has died and 18 others have gone missing along the Indo-China border in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey, District Deputy Commissioner Bengia Nighee has confirmed. Most of the 19 labourers, who went missing since July 5 from a construction site of a road project, were from Assam, Nighee added. The deceased's body was found in a nearby river.

39.title: Chinese authorities break into homes to look for COVID contacts, apologise
39.article_body: Authorities in southern China have apologised for breaking into the homes of people who had been taken to a COVID-19 quarantine hotel. Officials in Guangzhou reportedly broke into 84 homes to check for hidden close contacts and to disinfect the premises. The doors of the houses were later sealed and new locks were installed, as per the local media.

40.title: Funds slashed for Jamia & AMU, raised for BHU: Govt in Parliament
40.article_body: Funds allocated to Jamia Millia Islamia were reduced by ₹68.73 crore and Aligarh Muslim University by ₹306 crore in FY 2021-22 as compared to the previous fiscal, the government said in Parliament. According to MoS Education Subhas Sarkar, Banaras Hindu University was allocated ₹1,303.01 crore in FY 2021-22, almost double from ₹669.51 crore in FY 2014-15.

41.title: Rishabh Pant can be the future captain after Rohit Sharma: Arun Lal
41.article_body: Ex-India batter Arun Lal has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant can be Team India's future captain after Rohit Sharma. "He (Pant) is someone who is not afraid to play his game, can handle pressure well, can take the team out of tough situations and such a player can be a great leader," added Lal. Currently, Pant leads Delhi Capitals in IPL.

42.title: Cow urine will be used to make medicines in Chhattisgarh: CM Baghel
42.article_body: Soon after the announcement that Chhattisgarh government will purchase cow urine at ₹4 per litre, CM Bhupesh Baghel said that cow urine will be used to make medicines in the state to promote organic farming. "Our government is directly putting money in the pockets of people while Centre is taking money out of the pockets," Baghel added.

43.title: 3 arrested for stealing ₹12.2 crore from a private bank in Thane
43.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly stealing ₹12.20 crore from a private bank in Thane, an official said on Tuesday. The police recovered ₹5.80 crore out of the stolen cash and property worth ₹10 lakh from the accused, Senior Police Inspector Anil Honrao stated. The police is looking for the main accused and others involved in the crime, Honrao added.

44.title: Manoj Bajpayee approached for role of police officer in Pushpa 2: Reports
44.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has been reportedly approached to play the role of a police officer in 'Pushpa: The Rule', which is a sequel to Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa'. Actor Vijay Sethupathi has also been reportedly approached to play an important role, having opted out of the first part due to date issues. 'Pushpa' featured Fahadh Faasil in a police officer's role.

45.title: Hardik is India's most valuable player in white-ball cricket: Aakash
45.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya is currently Team India's most valuable player in white-ball cricket. "If Hardik is fit, his replacement is not available...The team has asked more, he has delivered more. So this has been an extremely beautiful thing," stated Aakash. Hardik picked four wickets and then scored 71 runs in the final ODI against England.

46.title: 2 men cheat 68-yr-old Mumbai man of ₹22 lakh by borrowing phone to play games
46.article_body: A retired BEST employee, Parkash Naik (68), was defrauded of over ₹22 lakh by two men after they allegedly transferred the money by borrowing Naik's mobile on the pretext of playing games. The accused, Shubham and Amar, were arrested after transferring the money to multiple accounts via UPI, police said. Notably, Naik filed the complaint at the Dindoshi Police Station.

47.title: Army personnel entitled to disability pension if it's attributable to service: SC
47.article_body: Army personnel will be entitled to disability pension only if the disability is attributed to military service or was aggravated by such service and if such condition is more than 20%, the Supreme Court said. The bench was hearing an appeal filed by the government challenging an order of the Armed Forces Tribunal which granted disability pension to army personnel.

48.title: Summer Olympics 2028 in Los Angeles to be held from July 14-30
48.article_body: The opening ceremony of the Summer Olympics 2028 in Los Angeles will be held on July 14 while the Games will conclude on July 30, organiser LA28 announced. The Los Angeles 2028 Paralympic Games will start on August 15 and close on August 27. Notably, the Paralympic Games will be hosted by Los Angeles for the first time ever.

49.title: Facebook Co-founder Saverin's B Capital raises $250 mn for 1st venture fund
49.article_body: B Capital Group, an investment firm run by Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin, raised $250 million for its first early-stage venture fund. The firm already has over $6 billion in assets under management. B Capital Chairman Howard Morgan said the firm plans to invest up to $2 million in seed rounds and $6-8 million in Series A rounds.

50.title: International child pornography racket busted in Gujarat, 1 arrested
50.article_body: The Gujarat Police on Tuesday claimed to have busted an international child pornography racket being run from the state's capital Gandhinagar. Police also arrested one accused in the case who confessed to running four international WhatsApp groups having members from countries like Russia and France. Around 600 photos and 224 videos were recovered from the arrested accused, police said.

51.title: Kids swim in MP school's campus as it floods after heavy rains; video viral
51.article_body: A video of students swimming in a government school's campus as it floods and "turns into a pool" amid heavy rains in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni has gone viral. A school staffer apparently took the video of the children, who'd been playing football before they started swimming. A person reportedly reacted to it, saying, "Aapda Me Avsar (opportunity in disaster)".

52.title: I'd pay for his funeral, jokes Akshay on what he'll do if Chris Rock makes fun of Twinkle
52.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, during his appearance on Koffee With Karan season 7, was asked how he would react if comedian Chris Rock made a joke about his wife Twinkle Khanna. "I would pay for his funeral," Akshay jokingly replied. Chris Rock was slapped by Will Smith at Oscars for making a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith.

53.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 4th richest?
53.article_body: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a $114 billion fortune, said Forbes. Elon Musk is the world's richest with $230 billion wealth, followed by Bernard Arnault ($148 billion) and Jeff Bezos ($139 billion). Larry Ellison, Warren Buffett, and Larry Page rank 6th, 7th and 8th on the world's 10 richest people list.

54.title: Man runs & gropes burqa-clad woman from behind on Pak street; video leads to outrage
54.article_body: A video of a man groping a burqa-clad woman from behind in broad daylight on a street in Pakistan's Islamabad has led to outrage in the country. The video shows the man running and attacking the woman. Responding to the video shared by a journalist, police assured action against the unidentified accused.

55.title: K'taka allows govt colleges to use student fees for development works
55.article_body: Karnataka government has allowed prescribed fees collected from students in 430 government first-grade, 91 polytechnic and 14 engineering colleges to be used for the development of the respective institutions. "The government aims to give financial autonomy to educational institutions...the respective institutions should be allowed to arrange their resources smoothly," an official order reads.

56.title: Arunachal court rejects bail plea of BJP MLA who is accused of rape
56.article_body: A court in Arunachal Pradesh on Monday rejected the anticipatory bail plea of BJP MLA from Koloriang, Lokam Tassar, who is accused of raping a pregnant woman at his residence. State CM Pema Khandu said that BJP will take action against Tassar if the allegations are proven to be true, adding, "No one is above...law." Tassar has been evading arrest.

57.title: K'taka makes hoisting Tricolour must in madrasas from Aug 11 to 17
57.article_body: The Karnataka government has made it compulsory for the madrasas in the state to hoist the national flag for six days from August 11 to 17 to celebrate 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. The order will also apply to other educational institutions, both government and private. Teachers and non-teaching staff have been directed to hoist the Tricolour at their residences.

58.title: US will bear consequences of Pelosi's visit to Taiwan: China
58.article_body: China's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan would seriously undermine China's sovereignty and territorial integrity. The US would have to bear the consequences of the visit, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said. This comes after the Financial Times reported that Pelosi was planning to visit China-claimed Taiwan in August.

59.title: Flipkart's Cleartrip suffers data breach, no sensitive info compromised
59.article_body: Global online travel company Cleartrip suffered a data breach on Monday, according to the company's email to its customers. "There has been a security anomaly that entailed illegal and unauthorised access to a part of Cleartrip's internal systems," the email read. While some personal details were a part of the leak, no sensitive information was compromised, the Flipkart-owned firm said.

60.title: Pak man who entered India to kill Nupur Sharma detained in Raj, 11-inch knife seized
60.article_body: A Pakistani national was detained in Rajasthan after he crossed the International Border to allegedly kill suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. An 11-inch long knife, religious books, clothes and sand were found in the bag of the man identified as Rizwan Ashraf, a senior BSF officer said. He was held on Saturday (July 16) near the Hindumalkot border outpost.

61.title: Anil charged ₹10 cr for 'JugJugg...', Kiara charged ₹3 cr: Report
61.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor charged ₹10 crore for 'JugJugg Jeeyo', according to a report. Meanwhile, Neetu Kapoor, director Raj Mehta and Kiara Advani together charged ₹12 crore, with ₹4 crore going to Neetu, ₹5 crore to Raj and ₹3 crore to Kiara, report said. Varun Dhawan reportedly worked on profit-sharing basis. The film has earned ₹83.12 crore in India so far.

62.title: 65-yr-old man blackmails, rapes neighbour for 26 yrs in Mumbai; arrested
62.article_body: A 65-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing his former neighbour for 26 years in Mumbai. The accused threatened to show photos and videos of the first time he raped the woman to her sons, assaulted her repeatedly and extorted ₹5-6 lakh from her. She approached police when he demanded to get her daughter-in-law to sleep with him.

63.title: Woman, her 7-yr-old daughter die after house collapses in Amravati
63.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her seven-year-old daughter were killed and three other family members sustained injuries after their house collapsed in Maharashtra's Amravati on Tuesday. An official said the old house might have collapsed due to heavy rainfall in the region.The three family members were rescued from under the debris by their neighbours and other people, the official added.

64.title: B'luru boy secures All India Rank 2 in ICSE Class 10; declared K'taka topper
64.article_body: Adi Kishore, a student of Bengaluru's Trio World School, has been declared the all-India second rank holder and the topper in Karnataka in the 2022 ICSE Class 10 examinations. Adi has scored 99.60% overall –  498 out of total 500 marks. "The teachers at Trio were incredibly supportive...when you enjoy your learning, you get rewarded in your performance," he said.

65.title: I would love to bowl against Virat Kohli again: James Anderson
65.article_body: Veteran England pacer James Anderson has said he would like to bowl against Virat Kohli again in the future. "So, maybe I will stick around for next tour, he added. Anderson bowled against Kohli in the rescheduled fifth Test in Edgbaston earlier this month. The 39-year-old picked a five-wicket haul in India's first innings.

66.title: Don't know why Pant was criticised, give him wings and he'll fly: Gough
66.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant, ex-England pacer Darren Gough said, "I don't know why he was criticised. You can tell he is a gifted cricketer. This guy, give him wings and he will fly." "It is a no-brainer that he will score runs," added Gough. Pant scored an unbeaten 125 off 113 balls in the third ODI against England.

67.title: Supreme Court grants protection from arrest to Nupur Sharma till August 10
67.article_body: The Supreme Court granted interim relief to suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma against whom multiple FIRs were filed for her remark on Prophet Muhammad. The apex court granted protection from arrest to Nupur and directed no coercive action should be taken against her till next hearing on August 10. Nupur had moved the court seeking clubbing of FIRs against her.

68.title: Seen my sister work really hard, I'll screw up anyone who trolls her: Janhvi
68.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor in an interview spoke about her sister Khushi Kapoor who'll make her debut in Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies'. "I've seen...[her] work...really hard...She wanted this so badly, I'm just so happy for her," she said. Janhvi further said she'll not entertain any sort of trolling towards Khushi, adding, "If anyone says anything bad about her...I'm gonna screw them up."

69.title: Didn't tell family: Goldstein on playing Hercules in 'Thor: Love & Thunder'
69.article_body: Actor Brett Goldstein revealed that he did not tell his family that he was playing Zeus' son Hercules in the Chris Hemsworth-starrer 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. "They put a chip in me that would explode if I f**king spoke about it. It was terrifying," he stated. Goldstein's character is introduced in the mid-credits scene of the MCU film.

70.title: Running away from discussion on price rise, GST hike unparliamentary: Rahul
70.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the central government over price rise, hike in GST and depreciating value of the rupee. "Running away from discussion and questions in Parliament is most 'unparliamentary', Prime Minister ji," Rahul tweeted in Hindi. The former Congress President was referring to a list of unparliamentary words released by the Lok Sabha Secretariat last week.

71.title: Will help build a strong, united India: Alva after filing nomination
71.article_body: Shortly after filing nomination papers for VP elections to be held on August 6, Opposition candidate Margaret Alva said that she will help in building a strong and united India. "I have spent my life fulfilling my commitments, with integrity and courage. Elections don't frighten me - winning and losing is a part of life," she said.

72.title: Camping, water sports banned near river banks in Himachal's Mandi
72.article_body: The tourism department and administration of Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district issued an order to ban all water sports activities and shut down all camping sites in Mandi on Tuesday. Due to the rainy season, all camping and sports activities near rivers will remain restricted till the season's end, Additional District Magistrate (ADM) Ashwani Kumar said.

73.title: Man arrested from UP for killing 65-year-old woman in Pune
73.article_body: Pune Police have nabbed a 27-year-old man who escaped to UP after allegedly murdering a 65-year-old woman and robbing her valuables at her residence in Katraj last week. The accused, who's a native of Prayagraj, had allegedly strangled the victim to death. The accused was brought back to Pune by police and has been remanded in custody till July 21.

74.title: UP worker fired for carrying PM, UP CM's photos in garbage cart reinstated
74.article_body: A sanitation worker in Uttar Pradesh's Nagar Nigam Mathura-Vrindavan, who was sacked after photographs of PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath were found in his garbage cart, has been reinstated. A video of the worker carrying the photos in the cart was widely shared online. He had apologised before the municipal commissioner on Monday.

75.title: Landslide hits petrol pump site in Himachal's Kangra, 6 labourers injured
75.article_body: At least six labourers were injured after a landslide hit a petrol pump site on Monday night in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra. The landslide occurred at the site where land was being excavated for the construction of a petrol pump. The labourers were admitted to a medical college in Tanda, from where one of the seriously injured was referred to Chandigarh.

76.title: List of items exempt from GST when sold loose released by Finance Minister
76.article_body: Amid criticism over pre-packaged and pre-labelled food items getting costlier after 5% GST was levied on them, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman released a list of items GST Council has exempt from GST if they are sold loose. They include pulses, wheat, rice and curd among others. "The decision is of GST Council and no one member," she clarified.

77.title: You can't play such innings if you're not responsible: Manjrekar on Pant
77.article_body: On being asked whether he was surprised by the responsibility showed by 24-year-old Rishabh Pant in the final ODI against England, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "You can't play [such] kind of innings if you are not responsible by nature." He added, "Pant was responsibility personified, he was calmness personified [in the match]." Pant scored 125*(113) to help India win the match.

78.title: Recruitment of Agniveers being done as per Army rules: Anurag Thakur
78.article_body: Reacting to Opposition's criticism regarding requirement for Agniveers to provide caste certificate during recruitment under the Agnipath scheme, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that recruitments are done as per Army Rules 1954 and Defence Service Regulation 1987. "Some parties like AAP try to mislead and lie. They tried to mislead youth without knowing the truth," he added.

79.title: Stabbed multiple times for watching Nupur Sharma's video, alleges Bihar man
79.article_body: A 23-year-old Bihar man alleged he was stabbed multiple times by a group of men in public for watching a video of suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma, which he had shared on WhatsApp. The man was stabbed on Friday (July 15) and is currently undergoing treatment. Two of the accused have been arrested and police are investigating the man's allegations.

80.title: Pune airport to get first-of-its-kind retail & co-working centre
80.article_body: Pune airport will get first-of-its-kind retail and co-working centre 'AeroMall' which is slated for launch in October. The centre has been developed at airport complex under public-private partnership model. "Co-working gained prominence during the pandemic...hybrid working air travellers are an obvious customer source," said Sunil Nahar, Director of Pebbles Infra-Tech, which developed the space.

81.title: Not considering any proposal to merge SAIL, Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd: Govt
81.article_body: Minister of State for Steel Faggan Singh Kulaste on Monday said no proposal to merge Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) and Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL) is under consideration. The government has proposed selling 100% stake in RINL along with management control by way of privatisation. The state-run steelmaker has been bearing losses for the last few years.

82.title: Sam Kerr becomes 1st female player to feature on EA's FIFA game global cover
82.article_body: Australian footballer Sam Kerr has become the first female player to feature on the global cover of the Electronics Arts' FIFA video game. Notably, this is the first such move in EA's nearly three-decade-old history. The Chelsea forward has featured alongside France's Kylian Mbappe on the cover of 'FIFA 23'. The 28-year-old footballer was WSL's top scorer last season.

83.title: Not an easy place to come, win games: Rohit on T20I, ODI series wins in Eng
83.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said England is "not an easy place to come and win" matches following his side's 2-1 win in both the T20I and ODI series in the country. "Came here, wanted to achieve something as a group in white ball. We were here last time and were beaten, I remember that," he added.

84.title: Shiprocket acquires Arvind’s omnichannel tech firm Omuni for ₹200 cr
84.article_body: Logistics startup Shiprocket has acquired textile firm Arvind's omnichannel technology business Omuni for about ₹200 crore, Shiprocket said on Tuesday. "Transaction will be carried out as a combination of stock and cash," it added. This comes about a month after Shiprocket acquired a majority stake in logistics firm Pickrr for $200 million in a mix of equity and cash transaction.

85.title: Mumbai man's decomposed body found inside bed at home; wife missing
85.article_body: The decomposed body of a 23-year-old tailor was found inside the storage area of a bed in his rented home in Mumbai, police said, adding that his wife, who is a suspect in the case, is missing. As per reports, the couple used to fight frequently. When the man's father called his daughter-in-law, she said her husband wasn't keeping well.

86.title: Man reaches kidnapper's house with gun to rescue wife in Bihar, held
86.article_body: A man reached a kidnapper's house with a pistol and bullets to rescue his abducted wife in Bihar's Matokhar village on Saturday. Kidnapper Vikash Kumar often used to visit the couple's house. He reportedly abducted the woman when her husband, Raju, wasn't at home. The two men have been arrested under the Arms Act. No FIR was registered for kidnapping.

87.title: Woman gives birth on floor outside Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital
87.article_body: A woman delivered her baby on the floor outside the emergency department of Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Tuesday morning. Her family alleged that she spent the night there after not being given access to a maternity ward or labour room. "Her papers clearly show that she was advised admission, but she did not reach the ward," a hospital spokesperson said.

88.title: Shiv Sena office-bearer attacked by unidentified persons in Nashik
88.article_body: A Shiv Sena office-bearer, identified as Nilesh alias Bala Kokane, was attacked with sharp objects by unidentified persons in the MG Road area of Nashik, Maharashtra. Kokane was rushed to a private hospital after being attacked while riding his two-wheeler, police said. The patrolling squads have combed the area to catch the unidentified attackers, police added.

89.title: Maneka writes to K'taka CM Bommai seeking probe into elephant's death
89.article_body: Lok Sabha MP Maneka Gandhi has written to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai seeking an investigation into the electrocution of an elephant in Hassan last year. She claimed the animal was killed deliberately for its tusks. The animal rights activist further accused JD(S) MP Revanna of getting the case transferred to the forest department so that the matter could be closed.

90.title: Ex-Congress MLA arrested over ruckus on Kerala CM's flight
90.article_body: Kerala Youth Congress Vice-President and former MLA KS Sabarinadhan was arrested on Tuesday in connection with last month's protest on a flight that was also carrying CM Pinarayi Vijayan. Sabarinadhan was summoned by police based on a WhatsApp chat in which he had allegedly suggested waving black flags at Vijayan on the flight.

91.title: Man, 10-yr-old daughter die after speeding truck hits bike in Pune
91.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 10-year-old daughter died after a speeding truck hit the bike the duo was riding on from behind in Pune on Tuesday, according to officials. The daughter, who was thrown at a distance during the accident, sustained grievous injuries and was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead on arrival, a police official said.

92.title: GHMC to conduct special drives against fast food corners in Hyderabad
92.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is planning to conduct special drives against fast food centres in Hyderabad. The corporation has reportedly received complaints about some fast food corners adding food colouring and other harmful additives in food to improve the taste. If food quality is found to be sub-standard, the owner will be booked and fined up to ₹5 lakh.

93.title: Religious events can't hinder traffic: CM Yogi amid Kanwar Yatra
93.article_body: Amid Kanwar Yatra, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said no religious activity should be allowed to hinder traffic movement. "Roads are for people to commute. No religious programmes should be allowed to hinder the traffic," he said. "Clear directives have been issued in this regard and it should be strictly followed with zero tolerance," CM Yogi added.

94.title: No plans to develop National Employment Policy: Ministry of Labour
94.article_body: Ministry of Labour and Employment on Monday said in the Lok Sabha that there is no plan to develop the National Employment Policy and added that there is no committee for drafting the same. "However, for evidence-based policymaking, the government has launched surveys on both demand and supply side," Union Minister of State for Labour and Employment, Rameswar Teli said.

95.title: Hyderabad to witness rainfall for next 4 days: IMD
95.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in Hyderabad for the next four days. While the maximum temperature is expected to drop to 30°C by Saturday, the minimum temperature is likely to be around 22°C, it added. Meanwhile, the Telangana State Development Planning Society (TSDPS) predicted light to moderate rainfall across Telangana till July 21.

96.title: US kills 2 al-Shabaab militants in airstrike in Somalia
96.article_body: The US has killed two al-Shabaab terrorists in an airstrike in Somalia on Sunday, US Africa Command (AFRICOM) said. The strike was conducted in coordination with Somali government after the terrorist group "attacked partner forces in a remote location near Libikus", it added. "Violent extremist organisations like al-Shabaab present long-term threats to Somali...and US interests," it further said.

97.title: It's like salt in too much sugar: Ayan on 'love storiyaan' in 'Kesariya'
97.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji has defended the lyrics of his film's song 'Kesariya'. Talking about the use of the words 'love storiyaan' in the song, he said, "We did not find it like elaichi [in biryani]." "We thought it was a twist like salt amid too much sugar, it has its own taste," he added.

98.title: BMC to reinstall tetrapods in Marine Drive after complaints of 'vibrations'
98.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to reinstall tetrapods back in their original location in Marine Drive after the residents complained of "unusual vibrations" during high-tide hours. The tetrapods that weigh tons were installed in late 90s to stop erosion of the coastline and few of them were reportedly removed for the ongoing Mumbai Coastal Road Project (MCRP).

99.title: Elon Musk planning to countersue Twitter over $44 billion buyout deal: Report
99.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk is planning to countersue Twitter after the company sued him for backing out of the $44 billion buyout deal, the New York Post reported. Musk has 20 days from the date of filing of Twitter's lawsuit to file his counterclaims. Twitter has accused Musk of attempting to "trash the company, disrupt its operations...and walk away".

100.title: Govt shares data showing changes in value of Indian rupee against US dollar since 2014
100.article_body: The government has shared data showing changes in the value of Indian rupee against US dollar since 2014. As per the government, the value of rupee against the US dollar has depreciated by more than 25% from December 31, 2014 to July 11, 2022. On Tuesday, the Indian rupee touched 80 per the US dollar for the first time ever.

101.title: Committee on MSP constituted by GoI comprises of BJP supporters: Raghav Chadha
101.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Tuesday said by excluding food bowl of India, Punjab, from the newly constituted MSP committee, BJP has once again shown its "anti-Punjab" stand. "Committee on MSP constituted by GoI comprises of BJP supporters and supporters of the three black laws," Chadha added. "Can they do justice to the cause of farmers?" he tweeted.

102.title: 7 e-bikes gutted in fire while getting charged in Pune showroom
102.article_body: At least seven electric bikes were burnt after a fire broke out at a showroom in Pune on Monday night. The incident took place when the vehicles were getting charged, officials said, adding that prima facie a short circuit might have occurred due to overcharging. No one was injured in the incident.

103.title: DSP run over by truck & killed by mining mafia during raid on illegal mining in Haryana
103.article_body: A Haryana police officer was allegedly killed by a mining mafia near Nuh on Tuesday. Tauru DSP Surender Singh had reached the spot after receiving information that illegal mining was being carried out. He signalled a stone-laden truck to slow down, but the driver instead sped up and ran him over, killing him on the spot.

104.title: Ready to fight over symbol, control of party: Shiv Sena's Raut
104.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the party was ready to fight over the symbol and control of the organisation. He added that BJP was trying to break Maharashtra into three pieces. "A few MPs and MLAs may be leaving us. But MLAs and MPs alone do not make up the Shiv Sena," Raut added.

105.title: WI's Lendl Simmons announces retirement from international cricket
105.article_body: Veteran West Indies opener Lendl Simmons has announced his retirement from international cricket aged 37. "I'm closing this chapter of international cricket having played 144 matches and scoring 3,763 runs from all formats. I want to thank the West Indies Cricket Team for the opportunities," wrote Simmons on Twitter. Simmons last played for WI in the 2021 T20 World Cup.

106.title: Courageous, admirable: Stakhovsky on Kasatkina coming out as gay
106.article_body: Reacting to Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina coming out as gay, former Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky tweeted, "It takes courage." "Nothing but admiration for your freedom," he added in his tweet. "Living in the closet is impossible...Living in peace with yourself is the only thing that matters...and f**k everyone else," Kasatkina had stated.

107.title: B'luru techie drowns in river in TN's Nilgiris while taking selfie
107.article_body: A 26-year-old IT professional, working in Bengaluru, drowned while taking selfies on the banks of the Sigurhalla river in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris district. According to police, the deceased visited Ooty with nine other colleagues and was staying in a private lodge. State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) found her body near the 20th hairpin turn at the foothills of Kalhatti slopes.

108.title: Building declared 'dangerous' 5 yrs ago collapses in Thane, 7 injured
108.article_body: A building that was declared "dangerous" almost five years ago, collapsed in Thane. The building had been emptied. However, seven people from adjacent chawl were injured in incident. The building was initially set up as a power loom unit and its first floor was meant to be residential space. Locals rushed to help after hearing a loud thud on Tuesday.

109.title: Go First Mumbai-Leh & Srinagar-Delhi flights face engine issues, grounded
109.article_body: Two flights of Go First airline, one from Mumbai to Leh and another from Srinagar to Delhi, have been grounded after facing engine glitches on Tuesday, DGCA officials said. The Mumbai-Leh flight was diverted to Delhi while the Srinagar-Delhi flight returned to Srinagar due to technical issues, the regulator said. DGCA said the aircraft can only fly after its clearance.

110.title: I miss feeling loopy but I feel really good now: Chrissy on 1 yr of sobriety
110.article_body: American model Chrissy Teigen took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a post marking one year of sobriety. "Not a drop of alcohol in 365 days! I miss feeling loopy...sometimes, but...toward the end, it didn't give that fun feeling anymore," she wrote. "I drank to end...anxiety that...mostly went away when I quit drinking! Anyhow, I feel really good," Chrissy added.

111.title: Modi ji made fall of rupee an election issue in 2014: Tharoor
111.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor criticised PM Narendra Modi-led government by holding them responsible for fall of rupee against US dollar and said, "Rupee has crossed 80. Modi Ji is the one who made it an election issue in 2014." "He was going to strengthen rupee...but then what is this strong government giving us? Even a weaker rupee," he added.

112.title: Selling public sector banks to chosen few will be disastrous: Jairam Ramesh
112.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has said that their party will oppose the BJP-led Centre's "Bank Sale Bill". "Today, 53 years ago, banks were nationalised. Now, the Modi government is on a privatisation spree," Ramesh tweeted. "Public sector banks must be equipped to face competition, but selling them off to a chosen few will be disastrous," he added.

113.title: DNA from blood in dead mosquitoes used to catch a burglar in China
113.article_body: Police in China's Fuzhou caught a burglar after they extracted blood from two dead mosquitoes in the house he stole from and used it for DNA testing to find him. Police said the house was freshly painted and they believed that blood stains they found on its wall might be that of the suspect who had spent the night there.

114.title: Why is Delhi CM so desperate to go to Singapore: BJP to Kejriwal
114.article_body: Taking a dig at Arvind Kejriwal's complaint about pending clearance from Centre for his Singapore visit, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari said, "Why's Delhi Chief Minister who doesn't have charge of any department in the government so desperate to go to Singapore?" West Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Singh said, "It's a mayors' summit yet Kejriwal is so desperate to go there."

115.title: Fake news: China on report it invited European leaders to meet Xi
115.article_body: A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman on Tuesday described a newspaper report saying that China had sent invitations to European leaders to meet with President Xi Jinping in November in Beijing as "fake news". Hong Kong's South China Morning Post newspaper on Monday cited an unnamed source as saying Beijing had sent invites to French, German, Spanish and Italian leaders.

116.title: Govt wants to implement TN’s medical check-up scheme across India: State minister
116.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian on Monday said that seeing the success of Tamil Nadu’s door-to-door medical check-up scheme, the Centre has sought its pattern to implement it across the country. Furthermore, he said, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has asked him to present details of the scheme at the World Economic Forum scheduled in Switzerland in January.

117.title: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam hospitalised after testing positive for COVID-19
117.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam has been admitted to a private hospital in Chennai after testing positive for COVID-19. As per his wife, the 66-year-old is doing fine now. This comes days after the teaser of Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part 1', which stars Vikram and Aishwarya, was released. Ratnam is a Padma Shri awardee and has won many National Awards.

118.title: Never been more brutal portrait of British colonisation: Piranha maker on RRR
118.article_body: Discussing 'RRR', 'Piranha' director Joe Dante said, "It's...a ridiculously melodramatic and violent...CGI fest that...[stays] continually enthralling." "I bet you've never seen anything...like it...There's [never] been a more brutal portrait of the horrors of British colonisation," added Dante. 'Doctor Strange' director Scott Derrickson had termed RRR as an awesomely outrageous roller-coaster.

119.title: Our equation is beyond cinema, we are like brothers: Sudeep on Salman
119.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep, while speaking about his bond with Salman Khan, said, "We are like brothers. Our equation is beyond cinema." Salman, who is one of the presenters of Sudeep's upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', launched its Hindi trailer last month. Sudeep further said Salman liked 'Vikrant Rona' and "took a clean interest in the Mumbai market".

120.title: Garbage dump yard in Punjab's Amritsar turned into mini forest
120.article_body: The land at a polluted garbage dump yard in an industrial site in Punjab's Amritsar has been transformed into a mini forest. "In just three months, three acres of land at the dump yard has turned into a green forest. There are 65 varieties of trees that have been planted here," an official said.

121.title: Viral video shows huge waves crashing wedding in Hawaii
121.article_body: A video went viral showing huge waves crashing a beachside wedding reception in Hawaii. In the video, dozens of people can be seen running away as surge of water overturned tables and chairs. During an interview with a local channel, the bridegroom said no one was injured in the chaos. "Everyone will remember their wedding forever," a Twitter user commented.

122.title: Which 6 IPL teams have reportedly bought franchises in South Africa's new T20 league?
122.article_body: As per reports, six franchises of South Africa's new T20 league have been bought by IPL teams. Mumbai Indians have bought the Cape Town franchise, while Chennai Super Kings have snapped the Johannesburg franchise and Delhi Capitals have got the Pretoria franchise. Meanwhile, Lucknow Super Giants bought Durban, SunRisers Hyderabad snapped Port Elizabeth and Rajasthan Royals bought Paarl.

123.title: Gautam Adani overtakes Bill Gates to become world's 4th richest person: Forbes
123.article_body: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person, according to Forbes. The development comes after the Microsoft Co-founder announced plans to donate $20 billion to his non-profit Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Gates' net worth now stands at over $102 billion, whereas Adani Group's 60-year-old Chairman has a fortune of more than $114 billion.

124.title: I'd pay for his funeral: Akshay on if Chris Rock joked about Twinkle
124.article_body: In the promo of 'Koffee with Karan 7', host Karan Johar asked Akshay Kumar what would be his reaction if comedian Chris Rock joked about his wife Twinkle Khanna. To this, Akshay replied, "I would pay for his funeral." In March, Hollywood actor Will Smith slapped Chris at the Oscars ceremony after he made a joke about Will's wife Jada.

125.title: Man dies in Delhi's Saket over honking and parking argument
125.article_body: A 32-year-old man died after being attacked with bricks and stones by a group of six men following an argument near Saket Metro station, police said. During interrogation, it was found that the argument broke out after the driver of the car, in which the victim was travelling, blew horn to park at the place where the accused were standing.

126.title: 7 quintals of ganja worth ₹1 crore, packed in 23 sacks, seized in Jharkhand
126.article_body: Seven quintals of ganja, packed in 23 sacks, were seized from a truck in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district. Police have arrested the driver of the truck and his helper in the case. Reports said that the truck was intercepted on National Highway 33. The cost of the ganja was estimated to be about ₹1 crore, Superintendent of Police said.

127.title: Cyberabad police shares accident video, says 'Follow Stop-Look-Go'
127.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Tuesday shared a video of an accident in Madhapur and urged people to follow "Stop-Look-Go" to prevent such incidents. In the accident, an over-speeding car rammed into another car which took a right turn without observing vehicles in the opposite direction, according to traffic police. The traffic police said that the accident was non-fatal.

128.title: BJP runs away from caste census but asks for caste from Agniveers: Tejashwi
128.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the Centre for allegedly asking for caste certificate during the recruitment of Agniveers.  "The BJP government runs away from the caste-based census but asks for caste from Agniveers," Tejashwi tweeted. "The caste is being asked because the country's largest casteist organisation RSS will later sort out Agniveers on the basis of caste," he added.

129.title: Pune sees rise in dengue cases, 50 confirmed in 2 weeks
129.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has said that there has been a rise in the number of dengue cases and added that 50 cases have been confirmed in two weeks. As many as 193 confirmed dengue cases and 72 chikungunya cases have been reported from January to July. There have been no deaths due to dengue, a medical official said.

130.title: 39 trains cancelled, 58 diverted after derailed goods train blocks Guj route
130.article_body: Till 9 am on Tuesday, 39 trains were cancelled and 58 others diverted after a goods train derailed and blocked the route in Gujarat's Dahod. Reports said that the cancelled trains include some local ones, while those diverted are all express trains. The train had derailed between Mangal Mahudi and Limkheda stations.

131.title: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva files nomination
131.article_body: Opposition's Vice President candidate Margaret Alva filed her nomination papers on Tuesday in the presence of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge and several Opposition leaders. Alva will be contesting against NDA's candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar. "It's a tough election...but I'm not afraid," Alva had tweeted earlier.

132.title: 1 killed, 4 injured as gunmen open fire at bar in Paris
132.article_body: At least one person was killed and four others were injured after two men opened fire at individuals seated at a bar's terrace in Paris on Monday night, police said. One of the attackers has been arrested, police added. There was "no element" at this stage to "know the motivations of this barbaric act", local mayor Francois Vauglin said.

133.title: Apple shares fall on report of plans to slow hiring, spending for some teams
133.article_body: Shares of Apple fell 2% on Monday after Bloomberg reported that the iPhone maker is planning to slow hiring and limit expenditures at some of its divisions next year. The potential move would see Apple joining tech giants like Meta, Google and Tesla which have announced similar plans. Apple has 154,000 full-time equivalent employees, as per its last annual report.

134.title: List of debtors after Sanjeev Kumar's death mind-boggling: Sister-in-law
134.article_body: Actor Sanjeev Kumar's sister-in-law Jyoti Nikul Jariwala said the list of debtors after Sanjeev's death was "mind-boggling", adding that the sum was in crores of rupees. "To tell you the truth, we still haven't recovered that money," she added. "Sanjeev is the reason I'm here...Lovers of cinema will always remember each and every performance of his," Anil Kapoor had stated.

135.title: Speaker adjourns Lok Sabha till 2 pm amid sloganeering by Oppn MPs
135.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday adjourned the House till 2 pm amid sloganeering from the Opposition MPs over the issues of price hike and inflation. Moreover, before adjourning the proceedings, he said that placards aren't allowed inside the House according to the rules. An advisory issued by the Lok Sabha earlier had prohibited placards in the House.

136.title: Girl jumps off school building to escape 5 men trying to gangrape her in Odisha
136.article_body: A girl has suffered critical injuries after jumping off the roof of a school building in Odisha's Jajpur district while trying to escape gangrape attempt by five men, police said. The five accused allegedly advised her and her brother to take shelter in the school amid heavy rain and later beat up her brother and attacked her.

137.title: I thought it was a joke: Aguero on Barca announcing Messi's departure
137.article_body: Sharing his reaction to Barcelona announcing the departure of Lionel Messi in 2021, his former teammate Sergio Aguero said, "I thought someone had hacked Barca's social networks. I thought it was a joke." Discussing Messi's exit from Barcelona, ex-Barcelona striker Luis Suarez had said he was "surprised" and "suffered" with Messi. Messi is Barcelona's all-time top scorer with 672 goals.

138.title: Sri Lanka Opposition leader withdraws from Presidential race
138.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa announced on Tuesday he has dropped out of the race to become President of the crisis-hit nation. Premadasa said he is withdrawing his candidacy "for the greater good" of the country that he loves. He added that the alliance and the Opposition partners will "work hard towards making" MP Dullas Alahapperuma the winner.

139.title: Vicious cycle against Zubair: Supreme Court on multiple FIRs in UP
139.article_body: Terming the multiple FIRs against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair a "vicious cycle", the Supreme Court on Monday ordered the UP government to not take "precipitative steps" against him until the next hearing. "What seems to be happening is as he gets bail in one case, he is remanded in another. This vicious cycle is continuing," said Justice DY Chandrachud.

140.title: Kerala minister writes to NTA over girls being told to remove bras at NEET centre
140.article_body: Kerala Higher Education Minister R Bindu has condemned the incident in which girls were allegedly told to remove their bras before entering a NEET exam hall in Kollam and said, "We've written to National Testing Agency (NTA) and the Centre expressing our disapproval of such action." "We have to ensure that a student's psychological condition is not hampered," she added.

141.title: Selfless decision by a great player: Azharuddin on Ben Stokes' retirement
141.article_body: Reacting to England Test captain Ben Stokes announcing retirement from ODI cricket, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said it's a "well thought" and "selfless decision by a great player". Azharuddin added, "No one listens to his body better than the player himself." Stokes announced retirement stating that playing all three formats is "unsustainable" for him.

142.title: 2 men rob people by threatening them with knife in Hyderabad, arrested
142.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Monday arrested two men for threatening people with a knife and robbing them of their mobile phones and cash. The duo reportedly approached the victims on a bike, threatened them with a knife used to cut coconut and robbed them. According to police, one of the accused has been involved in several past cases.

143.title: Vertical 'nap boxes' to let employees take rest during work being made in Japan
143.article_body: Two Japanese companies are collaborating to develop vertical 'nap boxes' that will allow employees to sleep while standing upright. According to the initial design, the sleeping pod will comfortably support a person's head, knees and rear so that they don't fall over. The companies are hoping to promote a healthier office culture with the 'nap box', also called 'Kamin box'.

144.title: Supreme Court transfers pleas challenging Agnipath scheme to Delhi HC
144.article_body: Supreme Court transferred three petitions challenging the Centre's Agnipath recruitment scheme to Delhi High Court. It felt "desirable and proper" to have Delhi HC's view, SC said. The petitioners said that the issue involves a pan-India problem and should be considered by SC. The court directed that all similar petitions pending in High Courts be filed as intervention applications.

145.title: Some cult films were box office duds: Swara on Taapsee's 'Shabaash Mithu'
145.article_body: A Twitter user asked actress Swara Bhasker about her thoughts after a female-driven film like Taapsee Pannu's 'Shabaash Mithu' had a low box office collection. To this, Swara replied, "I don't believe that box office earnings are the sole determinant of the value of films. Some...cult films were box office duds...some films, no better than tripe, have been hits."

146.title: Railways launches week-long 'Azadi ki Rail Gadi aur Station' celebration
146.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has announced plans to celebrate 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' from July 18-23, covering 27 trains and 75 railway stations across 24 states linked to the Indian freedom struggle. The week-long celebration will be called "Azadi ki Rail Gadi aur Station". The stations will be called "Swatantrata stations" and the trains will be called "spotlight trains".

147.title: Sushmita Sen's brother reacts to people trolling her, says 'she's a self-made woman'
147.article_body: Sushmita Sen's brother Rajeev Sen defended the actress after she was trolled over her relationship with Lalit Modi. "A lot has been said about my sister negatively regarding her current pictures with Mr Modi. I can proudly say that my sister is a self-made woman...She is a responsible mother and a role model for many Indians," Rajeev said.

148.title: Best film I've seen in a long time: Shilpa on Madhavan's Rocketry
148.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra took to her Instagram Stories to praise R Madhavan's directorial 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', calling it "a must-watch" film. "Madhavan, so proud of you...what a film! I was an emotional wreck," she wrote. "Loved every bit #nambinarayanan sir, you are such a HERO. Best film I have seen in a long time," Shilpa further wrote.

149.title: ED has become an extended part of BJP: Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi
149.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi on Monday said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has become an extended part of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). "Wherever the BJP is in Opposition in a state, action is taken against [leaders of] the ruling party," she added. "However, if [they] come after bathing in the Ganges of the BJP, the action...stops," she further said.

150.title: Bouncer beaten to death over parking near metro station in Delhi, 1 held
150.article_body: Police arrested a 22-year-old person after a 35-year-old bouncer was allegedly beaten to death by a group of five to six men following a quarrel over parking near Delhi's Saket Metro Station. The incident took place after the victim was returning with friends following his work at a club. The accused allegedly attacked the victim with bricks and stones.

151.title: In veiled attack, Sena's Sanjay Raut calls CM Shinde’s faction 'snakes'
151.article_body: Amid reports of Shiv Sena's MPs being in touch with Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, party leader Sanjay Raut launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction. "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes," he wrote. As per reports, 12 of 18 Shiv Sena's MPs are likely to join CM Shinde's camp.

152.title: Delhi Metro's Blue Line section hit by tech glitch
152.article_body: Train services between Indraprastha and Yamuna Bank stations on the Delhi Metro's Blue Line were impacted on Tuesday morning due to a technical glitch leading to a delay in service. The Blue Line connects Dwarka Sector-21 in Delhi and Electronic City in Noida with a branch at Yamuna Bank to Vaishali. The issue is yet to be rectified.

153.title: PM Modi pays tribute to Revolt of 1857 hero Mangal Pandey
153.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday paid tribute to Mangal Pandey, the hero of India's Revolt of 1857 against the British East India Company, on his birth anniversary. "The great Mangal Pandey is synonymous with courage and determination. He ignited the spark of patriotism at a very critical period of our history and inspired countless people," he tweeted.

154.title: Complaint that girls were forced to remove bras at NEET centre fictitious: Official
154.article_body: NEET exam centre superintendent in Kollam has denied the allegation of a girl's father who filed a police complaint stating that his daughter was asked to remove her bra before taking the entrance exam. The official said that the complaint is "fictitious and filed with wrong intentions". The students were allegedly asked to remove bras because of their metal hooks.

155.title: Had to deliver, so they come for more talent from India: Dhanush on Gray Man
155.article_body: Actor Dhanush has said he wasn't nervous to work with Russo Brothers in 'The Gray Man'. "I felt I'd a responsibility, now that the West is watching talents from India, I felt I'd to deliver so that they come for more talent from here," he added. Dhanush further said working with Russo Brothers was a "really simple and smooth process".

156.title: You can never rule out a player of his calibre: Karthik on Virat Kohli
156.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said the former India captain will come back recharged from the break he has been given and do "phenomenally well". He added, "You can never rule out a player of his calibre." Kohli has been rested for India's white-ball tour of West Indies comprising three ODIs and five T20Is.

157.title: Young couple end life on railway tracks in Rajasthan's Barmer
157.article_body: A young couple allegedly died by suicide in Rajasthan's Barmer district on Monday.  According to police, the young man aged 16 and the woman aged 23 jumped in front of a passenger train near the Mokalsar railway bridge. Police have also found a note near their bodies which read, "We both are ending our lives at our own free will."

158.title: Hardik can surpass Kapil Dev's record in white-ball cricket: Jaffer
158.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Hardik Pandya can definitely surpass Kapil Dev's record in white-ball cricket. "If he keeps bowling like this, (it can happen). He already has the batting capability," added Jaffer. Hardik picked six wickets in the three-match ODI series against England. He was the second highest run-getter in the ODI series, having scored 100 runs.

159.title: Still here, in our hearts: Twinkle on dad Rajesh's death anniversary
159.article_body: Actress-turned-writer Twinkle Khanna penned a note on her father Rajesh Khanna's 10th death anniversary. "10 years. He is still here. In all our hearts," she wrote. Along with the note, she shared an old picture of herself with the veteran actor. Bobby Deol, Manish Malhotra, Tisca Chopra and Tahira Kashyap reacted to Twinkle's post.

160.title: Boat carrying wedding guests capsizes in Pakistan, 20 killed
160.article_body: At least 20 people have died and several others are missing after a boat carrying more than 100 wedding guests capsized in a river in Pakistan's Punjab province on Monday, officials said. The cause of the accident is not yet known, but officials believe the boat was overcrowded. Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif expressed his grief over the incident.

161.title: Rahul Gandhi joins Oppn's protest on inflation on 2nd day of monsoon session
161.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday joined the Opposition’s protest over the issues of inflation and price rise, at the Parliament. The monsoon session of the Parliament began on Monday. "We will fight it tomorrow...We have appealed to all parties to fight against price rise and GST hike," Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Monday.

162.title: No state opposed 5% GST on food items at Council meet: Officials
162.article_body: No state opposed the move to bring pre-packaged commodities under GST in the 47th GST Council meeting, a senior official present in the meeting said. The Union Finance Minister is the Chairperson of the GST Council and states' Finance Ministers are its members. The rate rationalisations took place based on recommendations of a group of ministers (GoM), another official said.

163.title: Indian-founded Instacart's valuation cut by another 40% to $14.7 billion
163.article_body: American grocery delivery startup Instacart's valuation has been cut by another 40% to $14.7 billion by its investor Capital Group. The development comes months after the company slashed its valuation by about 40%, from $39 billion to $24 billion. Co-founded by Indian-origin Apoorva Mehta in 2012, Instacart confidentially filed for an IPO to go public in the US in May.

164.title: 13 men pose nude near Raj Bhavan to protest caste-based discrimination in Chhattisgarh
164.article_body: As many as 13 members of the Satnami sect staged a nude protest near Raj Bhavan in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Monday, alleging  discrimination based on caste. The police reportedly raided the houses of the protestors as they carried out the protest without permission. "Our faith in the constitution and Indian system is shaking," a protestor said.

165.title: 7-yr-old girl asks Maha CM Shinde to take her for vacation, he says 'yes'
165.article_body: A seven-year-old girl asked Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde to take her for a vacation to Guwahati during Diwali break. CM Shinde said "yes" and added that they will visit Kamakhya Mandir, a popular temple in Nilachal Hills in Assam's Guwahati. Reports said that the girl met the Chief Minister at his Nandanvan Bungalow on Sunday evening.

166.title: SC rejects father's plea seeking stay on 2nd autopsy after TN girl student's suicide
166.article_body: Supreme Court rejected the request of the father of a class 12 girl, who allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu, to put on hold the second autopsy scheduled for Tuesday. The re-postmortem was ordered by Madras High Court. Violent protests erupted in front of the 17-year-old student's school in Kallakurichi where she died by suicide, alleging torture by teachers.

167.title: Why is Parliament not debating on Ladakh border crisis?: Owaisi
167.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday asked, "Why is the Parliament not debating [on] the Ladakh border crisis?" "Why are my questions on Ladakh being denied in the Parliament? Why is [PM] Modi scared of truth coming out in the public? What is he hiding?" he added. "Is [PM] Modi going to take the responsibility for this failure?" Owaisi asked.

168.title: Pic captures the moment a train is stopped in middle of wildfire in Spain
168.article_body: A picture of the moment a passenger train stopping in the middle of a wildfire in Spain amid heatwave has surfaced online. The train was going from Madrid to Ferrol when it temporarily stopped due to the flame near the road, according to reports. "It was really scary to see how quickly the fire spread," a passenger said.

169.title: Nick Jonas shares pics from Priyanka's b'day, calls her 'Jewel of July'
169.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas shared pictures of actress and wife Priyanka Chopra's birthday celebration on Instagram. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "Happiest birthday...the jewel of July. So honoured to be on this crazy ride called life with you. I love you." In the pictures, Nick can be seen holding a towel which read, "Priyanka! The Jewel of July, est. 1982."

170.title: Trolling is part of life today: Ranbir Kapoor on memes on 'Kesariya'
170.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has reacted to trolls and memes related to his song 'Kesariya' over the lyrics of the song. "Today, memes...trolling are all part of life and it's fine as long as people enjoy the song, Pritam's music and Arijit Singh's singing," he stated. Ranbir added, "I want them to enjoy my chemistry with Alia...that's what the endeavour is."

171.title: Untalented, parasitical: Sylvester Stallone to 'Rocky' producer Irwin
171.article_body: Sylvester Stallone took to Instagram and called 'Rocky' and 'Creed' producer Irwin Winkler "untalented and parasitical". Stallone called out the producer while reviewing his son David Winkler's book, which he called "by far the worst". As per Stallone, three more movies in the 'Rocky' franchise would have been made had Irwin not been the producer.

172.title: Auto driver booked after man whom he knocked down, left near PMC dies
172.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked after a man whom the former allegedly knocked down in a road accident and left unattended near Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) entrance died. The deceased was found dead about a month ago. Reportedly, the auto-rickshaw driver had said that he'll take the deceased to the hospital but left the latter near PMC entrance instead.

173.title: Woman, her fiancé try to extort money from aunt in Bengaluru, arrested
173.article_body: A woman and her fiancé were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly using spy cameras to blackmail the woman's aunt over her extramarital affair. The accused, identified as K Usha and her fiancé Suresh Babu, had allegedly captured the victim's private moments on camera. They then used the clip to blackmail the victim and demanded ₹25 lakh from her, police said.

174.title: India reports 15,528 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,43,654
174.article_body: India has reported 15,528 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 16,935 new cases.
