The number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 1,43,654. The COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,25,785 after 25 persons lost their lives in the last 24 hours.

175.title: 7 arrested, including 5 women, for selling newborns in Delhi
175.article_body: Seven people, including five women, were arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly selling newborns to childless couples. During the arrest, an infant was also rescued by the police. The accused are named Veena, Madhu, Salmi, Bablu, Barkha, Jyoti, and Pawan. Notably, an absconding Jharkhand resident would hand over infants to the accused who would then sell them, police said.

176.title: Elon Musk responds as his pics from Mykonos vacation amid Twitter lawsuit go viral
176.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk responded after he was spotted vacationing in Greece's Mykonos, amid Twitter's lawsuit against him. Replying to a viral shirtless picture of him, he wrote on Twitter, "Maybe I should take off my shirt more often...(already back in the factory btw)." Musk was joined by Endeavor CEO Ari Emanuel and his wife Sarah Staudinger in Mykonos.

177.title: 26-year-old Indian-origin man shot dead in a nightclub in Canada
177.article_body: A 26-year-old Indian-origin man, Pardeep Brar who was critically injured in a nightclub shooting in Canada's Toronto, has passed away. Police said that a 24-year-old woman was also injured in the incident, but she was released from the hospital. The information on the suspect is yet to be released by police.

178.title: T20Is are different: Gavaskar on whether Pant can replicate ODI form
178.article_body: Following Rishabh Pant's maiden ODI hundred in the third ODI against England, Sunil Gavaskar said, "We will need to wait and see (whether Pant is able to replicate this form in T20Is)." "In T20Is, you've to start playing from third gear and move into fifth gear, so it is very different from ODIs," added Gavaskar. Pant scored an unbeaten 125.

179.title: Kohli is struggling, Dhawan looks rusty, Rohit also hasn't been consistent: Jaffer
179.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that the lack of runs from Team India top-order needs to be looked at. "Virat Kohli is struggling at the moment and Shikhar Dhawan is looking rusty. Rohit Sharma also hasn't been as consistent as we would want him to be," he stated. Kohli scored 33 runs in his two innings in England ODIs.

180.title: 220 kids who lost parents to COVID admitted to KVs: Govt tells Parliament
180.article_body: Union Ministry of Education informed the Parliament on Monday that as many as 220 children, who lost their parents to COVID-19, have been granted admission into centrally-run Kendriya Vidyalayas (KVs) under the PM CARES for Children scheme. According to data shared by the ministry, maximum admissions took place in Madhya Pradesh (68), followed by Uttar Pradesh (17) and Karnataka (16).

181.title: Elderly couple escaping wildfire in Portugal found dead in burned-out car
181.article_body: The charred bodies of an elderly couple were found inside a burned-out vehicle that crashed as they tried to escape a wildfire ripping across Portugal's northern municipality of Murça, authorities said on Monday. The couple was aged over 80. The wildfire in Murça is one of nine blazes sweeping across  Portugal, which has been battling a heatwave since last week.

182.title: Around 2 lakh pilgrims perform ongoing Amarnath Yatra till date this year
182.article_body: Nearly two lakh pilgrims have performed the ongoing Amarnath Yatra till date this year and 15,642 pilgrims had 'darshan' at the cave shrine on Monday, said officials. "Since the Yatra started on June 30 this year, 1,99,453 have performed the Yatra," Officials of Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board (SASB) said. Total 32 pilgrims lost their lives during the Yatra this year.

183.title: Lulu mall turned into political hotbed: Yogi to Lucknow admin, police
183.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday criticised the Lucknow administration and police over protests at Lulu mall, saying that it's been turned into a "political hotbed". "Miscreants...should be dealt with strictly...No one should be permitted to obstruct traffic on the road by organising prayer or other events," he added. He also told the administration to take the matter "seriously".

184.title: Allahabad HC rejects revision petition in Babri Masjid demolition case
184.article_body: Allahabad HC's Lucknow bench rejected the revision petition filed against the acquittal of all 32 accused persons in the Babri Masjid demolition case. It directed its office to convert and treat the revision as a criminal appeal. Those accused include former Deputy PM LK Advani, the then UP CM Kalyan Singh, BJP leaders Murli Manohar Joshi, Uma Bharti and others.

185.title: Took 11 hrs to complete 'Kun...', was asked do to wuzu before singing it: Javed
185.article_body: Singer Javed Ali said that it took around 11 hours to complete the song 'Kun Faya Kun'. "I vividly remember I was asked to do wuzu before singing the song, which made experience very wholesome. So, all three of us [Javed Ali, AR Rahman, Irshad Kamil] were at studio and started recording the song till the next morning," he added.

186.title: Character assassination: BJP on Tejashwi's 'Nityanand desired to join RJD' remark
186.article_body: BJP spokesperson Nikhil Anand reacted to RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav’s statement that MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had expressed his desire to join RJD. "A dyed-in-the-wool RSS man like Nityanand Rai will prefer death to any association with RJD. His rising stature is causing troubles for Tejashwi Yadav and his family, so they're indulging in character assassination," Anand said.

187.title: Treating wife like a 'cash cow' without any emotional attachment is mental cruelty: HC
187.article_body: While granting divorce to a couple, Karnataka High Court held that a husband treating his wife as a cash cow and using her money without having any emotional attachment towards her would amount to mental cruelty. The bench stated that the husband had taken ₹60 lakh from the wife on the pretext of carrying out business.

188.title: Got a big playground to play as an actor: Rao on working with Raj & DK
188.article_body: Rajkummar Rao shared his experience of working with filmmaker duo Raj and DK in upcoming web series 'Guns & Gulaabs' and said, "They are phenomenal...The quirk and humour they have are so unconventional." "I got such a big playground to play as...actor, there was so much to explore," he added. Raj and DK also directed Manoj Bajpayee-starrer 'The Family Man'.

189.title: Chhattisgarh to start purchasing cow urine at ₹4/litre from July 28
189.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister's Office (CMO) has announced that the state government will begin the purchase of cow urine at the proposed minimum rate of ₹4 per litre from the festival of 'Hareli Tihar' on July 28. In the first phase, the cow urine will be procured from two independent 'gauthans' in each of the state's districts, the CMO said.

190.title: Downey Jr has always been someone I've looked to for guidance: Evans
190.article_body: Actor Chris Evans, while speaking about his 'Avengers' co-star Robert Downey Jr, said, "Downey and I'd been through together at a time in my career where I was still uncertain, still feeling things out, trying to take on a pretty big role." "So, he's always been someone I've looked to for guidance and who better could you ask?" Evans added.

191.title: People are 'still surprised' about women understanding cricket: Saiyami
191.article_body: Actress Saiyami Kher said she finds it "strange" that people are still surprised about a woman loving and understanding cricket or other sports. "People find it difficult to accept women watching [a] sport or (playing it) as they are still stuck in a stereotypical world," added Saiyami. "The reality is different...This dated mentality needs to change," she stated.

192.title: Flight tickets under name 'Mr Ballot Box' bought for Presidential poll ballot boxes
192.article_body: As the voting for the Presidential election concluded on Monday, ballot boxes were sent to Delhi from different states. Earlier, the Election Commission of India sent ballot boxes to 14 states/UTs for the Presidential polls, and separate 'two way' air tickets were booked for the boxes under the name 'Mr Ballot box', a picture of which has surfaced online.

193.title: Delhi govt to conduct door-to-door survey in Aug for issuing e-health cards
193.article_body: The Delhi government is expected to start a door-to-door survey this August for creating a health database for its e-health cards and health information management system (HIMS), health officials said. The department aims to distribute the cards in November or December, they added. This information will help Delhi government hospitals to record and track each patient's medical history.

194.title: Irked by poor roads, Thane man carries mud & gravel in car, fills potholes
194.article_body: Irked by the poor condition of roads, Sangam Dongre, a 42-year-old resident of Thane, got out of his car with some placards, protested against the potholes and started filling them on Monday. "I travel...[regularly] from Naupada to Shahapur...poor condition of roads has made travel very difficult. Hence, I carried a sack of mud and gravel...to cover this stretch," he said.

195.title: Mumbai to receive low rainfall for next 10 days: Skymet
195.article_body: A private forecaster, Skymet Weather Services, has predicted that for the next 8-10 days the rain intensity in Mumbai will be low as there are no significant weather systems for heavy rainfall around the city. However, subdued monsoon activities will continue, the weather forecaster added. On Monday, Mumbai's temperature increased 3.8 degrees Celsius compared to Friday.

196.title: Nude protest against caste-based discrimination staged near Raj Bhavan in Raipur
196.article_body: Members of the Satnami sect staged a nude protest near Governor House in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Monday, alleging that discrimination based on caste has not ended yet. The protest was reportedly carried out without permission and police raided residences and other locations of the protestors. Around half a dozen agitators were detained by the police for staging demonstrations, reports said.

197.title: Man seen doing pushups on moving truck falls in UP, police shares pics of injuries
197.article_body: Lucknow ADCP Shweta Srivastava shared a video of a shirtless man doing pushups on a moving truck. He could be seen falling off the truck in the end. Sharing pictures of his injuries, Srivastava said, "He was trying to be 'Shaktiman', but now won't be able to sit for a few days! WARNING: Please don't do such deadly stunts!"

198.title: I would bowl leg-spin as I'm a big fan of Anil Kumble: S Sreesanth
198.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer S Sreesanth said he started off as a leg-spinner as he is a "very big" fan of Anil Kumble, adding that he also tried to copy Shane Warne. Discussing his decision to become a pacer, Sreesanth stated, "Tinu Yohannan played for India so I thought if he can play for India...then I need to be a fast bowler."

199.title: Haryana Congress MLA resigns over threat calls; withdraws it later
199.article_body: Congress MLA from Haryana's Sonipat, Surender Panwar, resigned from Vidhan Sabha. However, he withdrew his resignation letter five days later after an assurance from Assembly Speaker Gian Chand Gupta. Panwar claimed that he received a threat call from Dubai and the caller had demanded a ransom from him. "The Speaker assured me and all other MLAs complete protection," he said.

200.title: Teenage girl saves mother from being stabbed to death by stepfather in Delhi
200.article_body: A 15-year-old girl saved her mother, Saraswati Barman, from getting stabbed to death by her stepfather, Gajan Barman, in Delhi's Govindpuri area. The girl managed to stop Gajan, not before he had stabbed Saraswati a few times, by pushing and punching him, police said. Saraswati was rushed to a hospital by the police. Notably, Gajan allegedly ill-treated her stepdaughter.

201.title: Reliance Jio submits highest deposit of ₹14,000 crore for 5G spectrum auction
201.article_body: Reliance Jio Infocomm submitted the highest earnest money deposit of ₹14,000 crore for upcoming 5G spectrum auction, as per the Department of Telecommunications data. Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have deposited ₹5,500 crore and ₹2,200 crore as earnest money, respectively. Meanwhile, Adani Data Networks, which earlier said it has no plans to enter consumer mobility segment, deposited ₹100 crore.

202.title: Not necessary for Bihar farmers to migrate to other states for jobs: Tikait
202.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait has said that the farmers of Bihar should come forward for their rights and raise their voices. "It is not necessary for the farmers of Bihar to migrate to other states for jobs," he added. "If any farmer would get a genuine price for the crops, why would he go to other states?" Tikait asked.

203.title: Beggary Act will be strictly enforced in K'taka: Social Welfare Minister
203.article_body: Karnataka's Social Welfare and Backward Classes Welfare Minister Kota Shrinivas Poojari on Monday said the government would strictly enforce the Karnataka Prohibition of Beggary Act, 1975, in the state to end begging. Poojari said, "101 children...involved in begging have...been taken into custody." He added that a case will be registered against those who leave children on streets for begging.

204.title: Delhi man sends morphed pics, videos of woman to her in-laws; arrested
204.article_body: A man, who hails from Delhi's Tughlakabad, was arrested for allegedly sending morphed nude photos and obscene videos of a woman to her husband and in-laws on Instagram. The 22-year-old woman had recently got married. According to police, there was a marriage proposal to her from the accused's family, but due to his criminal background, it was turned down.

205.title: mCaffeine announces Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer during its Big BOGO Days
205.article_body: Natural and 100% Vegan brand mCaffeine has announced its Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer starting July 19, adding that it's even bigger this time as 5 lucky winners stand a chance to win iPhone 13. Launched in 2016, the brand offers caffeinated skin and hair care product range. Users can use code BOGO at checkout to avail the offer.

206.title: It's time for David Warner's leadership ban to end: Greg Chappell
206.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Greg Chappell has said it's time for the leadership ban imposed on David Warner to end. "He obviously had a central role in what happened but he was not the only one...I don't know why he should be treated any differently," said Chappell. The ban was imposed on Warner for his role in the 2018 ball-tampering scandal.

207.title: Court upholds Ansal brothers' conviction in 1997 Uphaar cinema fire case
207.article_body: A Delhi court upheld the conviction of Sushil Ansal and Gopal Ansal over tampering with evidence in the 1997 Uphaar cinema fire case. It acquitted one co-accused, Anup Singh, in the case and granted him bail. A magisterial court had earlier convicted and awarded seven years in jail to the Ansal brothers, along with a fine of ₹2.25 crore each.

208.title: Boris Johnson takes video selfie while flying in Typhoon fighter jet
208.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson took a selfie video while flying in Typhoon fighter jet, days after he announced his resignation from the post. He was offered a go on the £75 million RAF plane while visiting a Lincolnshire base. In the video, he could be seen giving a thumbs up, while two other planes jet alongside.

209.title: His voice brought joy to millions: Ajay Devgn on singer Bhupinder Singh
209.article_body: Reacting to the demise of veteran singer Bhupinder Singh, Ajay Devgn has said, "His voice brought joy to millions and had a uniqueness." "Deeply saddened about the demise of Bhupinder ji...Condolences to his family," he added. The singer, known for songs like 'Naam Gum Jayega' and 'Honthon Mein Aisi Baat', passed away of colon ailment at the age of 82.

210.title: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal's fortune rose by $12 billion in two years: Forbes
210.article_body: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal witnessed her fortune rise by $12 billion in the last two years, according to Forbes. Jindal's net worth stood at $4.8 billion in 2020 and it has surged to $17.7 billion this year. The 72-year-old is the head of the OP Jindal Group, founded by her late husband Om Prakash Jindal in 1952.

211.title: 'Want to cast all my family in a film, call it nepotism', jokes Janhvi
211.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said she hasn't been able to meet other family members due to their respective busy schedules. "The only way now to get the family together is to just do a film...like cast everyone in the family," she jokingly stated. "Maybe we'll have to call it nepotism only because it's all in the family," she added.

212.title: Getting 1800s train was impossible, created 400-foot train: Shamshera director
212.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra said they created a 400-foot train for action sequence in the movie. "One...larger-than-life action sequence happens on a train. There were challenges because getting a train from the 1800s wasn't possible," he said, adding, "We were clear...that whatever we did, it had to look like it was from the era that the film was set in."

213.title: $18mn worth of elephant tusks, other animal parts seized in Malaysia
213.article_body: Malaysian authorities have seized nearly $18 million of wildlife contraband, their biggest seizure to date. The Customs Department said it discovered the contraband hidden behind sawn timber following checks on a ship on July 10. The shipment included 6,000 kg of elephant tusks, 100 kg of pangolin scales and 25 kg of rhino horns. The shipment reportedly arrived from Africa.

214.title: Before becoming Minister, Nityanand expressed desire to join RJD: Tejashwi
214.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav claimed that Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had come with a request to be taken into RJD when he had not become a minister. Tejashwi said this after Rai criticised him for his "murti" remark against NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. Rai had "no moral courage" to react, Tejashwi said.

215.title: Rupee hits 80 per US dollar for the first time ever
215.article_body: The Indian rupee touched 80 per US dollar for the first time ever on Tuesday after opening at 79.99 per dollar. The rupee declined for the eighth consecutive session after crude oil surged on concerns about tighter supplies globally. At the time of writing, rupee was trading at 80.01 per dollar, after touching a fresh record low of 80.02.

216.title: Not going to be scared of anyone: Oppn's VP candidate Margaret Alva
216.article_body: Margaret Alva, the Opposition’s candidate for Vice President elections, on Monday said in politics, winning or losing is not the issue, fighting the battle is. "I will file the nomination tomorrow and will fight their (NDA's) campaign…I am not going to be scared of anyone," she added. Jagdeep Dhankhar, BJP-led NDA’s nominee for Vice President, filed nomination papers on Monday.

217.title: Not Tests, but future of ODIs looks uncertain: Ojha after Stokes' retirement
217.article_body: After England all-rounder Ben Stokes announced retirement from ODIs, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha said, "We were worried about the Test cricket's future but the future of ODIs looks uncertain!" He added, "We may see many cricketers preferring to move away from this format." Stokes announced retirement stating that playing all three formats is "just unsustainable" for him.

218.title: I don't put limitations on myself: Sudeep on breaking language barrier
218.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep said he doesn't put limitations on himself by sitting in a pre-conceived notion that he can do this and he can't do this. "If [the project] excites me, I just go ahead," he added. Sudeep stated, "I'd continue to do films for my directors...writers of my...state, also for all those...who write for me in other industries."

219.title: Hardik, Pant can form a pair like Yuvraj, MS Dhoni were: Gavaskar
219.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant can "definitely" form a pair similar to Yuvraj Singh and MS Dhoni. "Both had the ability to hit huge sixes and...ran well between wickets," added Gavaskar. Hardik and Pant stitched a partnership of 133 runs off 115 balls in the third ODI against England which India won by five wickets.

220.title: Police arrests nephew for murder of former BBMP corporator's husband
220.article_body: Days after former BBMP corporator Nazima Khan's husband was stabbed to death in Bengaluru, the police arrested his nephew in the case. Mateen Khan, who allegedly killed his uncle on July 13, was arrested from Kengeri on July 17, said Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Laxman B Nimbargi. Mateen had reportedly killed Ayub Khan over the presidentship of a mosque.

221.title: Pune Municipal Corporation invests ₹800 crore in govt securities
221.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has invested almost ₹800 crore in government securities till date, according to Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar. The civic body's Chief Accounts and Finance Officer Ulka Kalaskar said that this was done to get maximum returns as "fixed deposit interest rates [have] declined". The move is "completely safe" and supported by the Centre and RBI, she added.

222.title: My father was a big bully, he used to test his directors: Ranbir
222.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his late actor-father Rishi Kapoor was a "big bully", adding that he used to "test his directors". "If he comes on too strong and...director doesn't hold his own and agrees to everything he says, he knows he has to take over the project," Ranbir added. "So he always did this testing thing," said Ranbir.

223.title: Delhi govt to train women as commercial drivers, to bear 50% cost
223.article_body: In a bid to recruit more women into the public transport network, Delhi government in collaboration with app-based aggregators will train about 1,000 women to become professional drivers. Women trained under this initiative would receive guaranteed jobs in these companies, the government said. Notably, 50% of the training cost for each woman (around  ₹4,800) will be borne by the government.

224.title: B'luru to get flyover linking Outer Ring Road & West of Chord Road
224.article_body: The foundation stone of a new flyover that will connect the Outer Ring Road and West of Chord Road towards Kurubarahalli Pipeline Road in Bengaluru was laid on Sunday. The half-kilometre flyover is expected to help decongest traffic. It will be constructed at a cost of ₹5.5 crore, said State's Urban Development Minister Byrathi Basavaraja.

225.title: BMC forcibly evicts residents from 7 'dangerous' buildings in Mumbai
225.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) forcibly evicted occupants from seven buildings located in Juhu-Vile Parle ward, which were declared unfit for habitation. The civic body had to take this step as the occupants refused to vacate the buildings even after their water and electricity supply were disconnected. Last month, a building in Kurla collapsed, leading to death of 19 residents.

226.title: B'luru commuters decry auto-rickshaw woes, say apps not reliable
226.article_body: Several people in Bengaluru have expressed concerns about the high auto-rickshaw fares in the city, saying the daily commute has become a major challenge for them. "The auto drivers in the city stopped using their fare meter long time ago," said a student. An IT employee said even app-based services like Ola and Uber are unreliable.

227.title: Bomb squad searches Mumbai area after hoax call from jobless, drunk cook
227.article_body: The bomb detection and disposal squad of the Mumbai Police searched the Mahalaxmi Race Course area of Mumbai after a cook, in drunk condition, informed the control room that bombs are going to be planted in the area. It was later found to be a hoax call. Reports said the cook had lost his job one day ago.

228.title: Rishi Sunak tops 3rd round of voting for new UK PM, only 4 remain in race
228.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Monday won the most votes in the third round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as UK PM. Sunak received 115 votes, ahead of Trade Minister Penny Mordaunt (82 votes), Foreign Secretary Liz Truss (71 votes) and ex-Equalities Minister Kemi Badenoch (58 votes). These four candidates will enter fourth round of voting on Tuesday.

229.title: Will veto Sweden, Finland's NATO bids if promises not kept: Turkey
229.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday warned that Turkey will veto the NATO membership bids of Sweden and Finland if they fail to keep their promises of extraditing individuals with alleged terror links. Erdogan said that he believes Sweden is "not showing a good image" for now. Sweden and Finland had agreed to consider Turkey's extradition requests last month.

230.title: Govt shares meme on fake post on 'liquor pipeline' connection at home, says 'chill guys'
230.article_body: Stating that a viral post claiming that people can apply for a "liquor pipeline" at their homes is fake, the government said, "Chill guys, Don't get your hopes too high." It also shared a picture of Nana Patekar from the movie 'Welcome', which has "control..." written in caption. The viral fake post demanded ₹11,000 from connection.

231.title: Pune records coolest maximum temperature in July since 2012
231.article_body: Amid heavy rains on most days in July, Pune recorded the highest day temperature at 30°C on July 3 and July 4, which is the coolest maximum temperature recorded in July since 2012. The all-time record for the warmest day in Pune in July was in 1966 when the highest maximum temperature reported was 36°C.

232.title: Mairaj Khan creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win men's skeet gold at ISSF World Cup
232.article_body: Indian shooter Mairaj Ahmed Khan on Monday created history by winning the country's first-ever ISSF World Cup gold medal in men's skeet. In the 40-shot final, the 46-year-old from Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh shot 37 to finish ahead of Korea's Minsu Kim (36) and Britain's Ben Llewellin (26).

233.title: Pant reacts to Yuvraj's '45-minute conversation made sense' tweet, says 'It did, indeed'
233.article_body: After former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh praised Rishabh Pant for scoring his maiden hundred and said that their 45-minute conversation made sense, the 24-year-old Team India wicketkeeper responded to Yuvraj's tweet. He wrote, "It did, indeed Yuvi pa." Pant scored 125*(113) to help India defeat England in the ODI series decider.

234.title: Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina comes out as gay, shares pics
234.article_body: Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina, in a recent interview, came out as gay. "Living in the closet is impossible. [It's] not for the long run...Living in peace with yourself is the only thing that matters...and f**k everyone else," she said. She later shared a picture of herself with her girlfriend Natalia Zabiiako, who's an Olympic medal-winning pair skater.

235.title: Twitter accuses Musk of 'slow-walking' trial, says 'it is harming us each day'
235.article_body: Twitter has accused the world's richest person Elon Musk of trying to "slow walk" the company's lawsuit against him for backing out of the $44-billion deal. "Millions of Twitter shares trade daily under a cloud of Musk-created doubt...This very public dispute harms Twitter with each passing day," Twitter said, urging the judge to hold a trial at earliest possible date.

236.title: 2 teachers booked for forcing girl students to remove uniforms near Delhi
236.article_body: At least two teachers of a government school were booked for allegedly forcing two Dalit girl students to remove their uniforms in Hapur near Delhi, police said. The teachers were taking photographs of students in school dress and two girls were allegedly asked to remove their uniforms and give them to two other girls who were not in school dress.

237.title: Live organs transported in 23 mins via green corridor in Hyderabad
237.article_body: Rachakonda and Hyderabad Traffic Police provided a green corridor for the transportation of live organs, heart and lungs, from Kamineni Hospitals in LB Nagar to Apollo 24x7 in Jubilee Hills, police said. The organs covered a distance of 21 km in 23 minutes during the transportation, police added. Rachakonda Police Commissioner commended the Rachakonda Traffic Police's service, police further said.

238.title: Dad Boney couldn't try acting as he was focused on brothers: Janhvi
238.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has revealed her father and producer Boney Kapoor could have tried acting if he didn't have the pressure of his father's business and his brothers' acting careers. "After work, he used to watch old music videos and act it out...I remember mom (Sridevi) would be like, 'I'm...glad...you didn't become an actor, you'll be so vain'," she added.

239.title: No force, 15 yrs of change happened in 2 yrs: Sudeep on South films in North
239.article_body: While talking about films from South working in North, actor Kiccha Sudeep said it "hasn't been forced". "It's high time we got theatrical releases...which we are now...It was bound to happen but what has happened in these two years is almost 15 years of change," he said, adding, "If I give you what you haven't seen...you will be interested."

240.title: 4 people shot at nightclub in Spain, suspected attacker stabbed
240.article_body: Four people were shot and one other was stabbed with a knife at a nightclub in the Spanish town of Marbella, police said on Monday. The person who was stabbed is suspected to be the one who opened fire, police added. Police informed that two of the four people who were shot and the suspect were in serious condition.

241.title: India and Fiji hold 5th Foreign Office Consultations in Suva
241.article_body: Delegations from India and Fiji held the fifth Foreign Office Consultations on Monday in Suva during which the entire gamut of bilateral relations between the countries was reviewed, the Indian High Commission in Suva said. The two sides also discussed ways to strengthen bilateral ties, the mission added. It further informed that the Indian delegation met senior Fijian cabinet ministers.

242.title: J&K LG announces 10% reservation for 'Agniveers' in police
242.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Sunday announced a 10% reservation in the UT's police force for those who retire after serving in the military under the Agnipath scheme, PTI reported. Sinha said that his decision was influenced by the suggestion of two youths from Jammu. He further directed state officials to ensure that aspiring 'Agniveers' get the resources they need.

243.title: Terror hideout busted by security forces in J&K's Ramban district
243.article_body: Security forces busted a terror hideout and seized a cache of ammunition and explosives in J&K's Ramban district on Monday, officials informed. The hideout was detected during a joint search operation by the Rashtriya Rifles and the police, officials added. According to officials, a grenade, 35 AK rounds, explosive material and seven pistol rounds were among the items seized.

244.title: Goa reports 100% voter turnout in Presidential polls
244.article_body: All 40 eligible members of the Goa Legislative Assembly, including CM Pramod Sawant, voted in the Presidential elections on Monday. The polling started at 10 am and all 40 MLAs had voted by 1:50 pm, Secretary of the Goa Legislative Assembly Namrata Ulman said. She added that the polling was conducted smoothly and no complaints or objections were raised.

245.title: Yasin Malik to go on hunger strike if 'fair trial' demand not met
245.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik said that he will go on hunger strike from July 22 if his demands for a fair trial are not met, the Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) stated. Malik moved an application to the Centre seeking personal appearance in two cases. He is currently serving a life sentence in a terror funding case.

246.title: Report claims Ronaldo to join Sporting CP as car seen at stadium, he calls it 'fake'
246.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has branded reports of a return to Sporting CP on loan as 'fake'. Reports had emerged from Portugal on Sunday claiming the Manchester United forward was at Sporting CP's Jose Alvalade Stadium to discuss a loan return to his boyhood club. A report had also included a picture of Ronaldo's car in the stadium.

247.title: Bajrang Dal activist attacked in Uttar Pradesh
247.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist, Prashant Saini, was attacked in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district by unidentified miscreants, the police said. Saini was on his way to pick up his son from school when he was attacked by five-six men, Additional Superintendent of Police Rajesh Kumar said. The activist was rushed to the hospital while an FIR was registered against the attackers.

248.title: Male model, friend arrested with cannabis worth ₹1cr; supplied drugs in DU campus
248.article_body: A 25-year-old Delhi-based model named Shubham Malhotra and his 27-year-old friend Kriti have been arrested with premium quality 'charas' (cannabis) worth ₹1 crore. The duo allegedly supplied drugs to youngsters around the Delhi University (DU) campus. They were allegedly procuring 'charas' from Himachal Pradesh's Malana and transporting it to Delhi hidden in a pillow in their car.

249.title: 2-time Olympic champion Crouser wins 1st shot put world gold in US sweep
249.article_body: Two-time Olympic gold medallist and world record holder Ryan Crouser won his first gold medal at World Athletics Championships in Oregon on Sunday as he led a US clean sweep with a championship record throw of 22.94 metres. Defending champion Joe Kovacs threw 22.89 metres to clinch silver, while Josh Awotunde won bronze with a personal best of 22.29 metres.

250.title: CBI arrests 8 persons for alleged malpractices in NEET UG 2022 exam
250.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested eight people on Monday for alleged malpractices in NEET UG 2022 exam held on July 17. The CBI claimed that candidates' user IDs and passwords were collected by the accused, who made necessary modifications to get desired examination centres. The accused also tried to morph photographs to facilitate use of proxy candidates.

251.title: If I get 20 minutes with Virat Kohli, I might be able to help him: Sunil Gavaskar
251.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, Sunil Gavaskar said, "If I had about 20 minutes with him...I'd...tell him the things he might've to do. It might help him." He added, "Having been an opening batter...having been troubled by [off-stump] line...there are certain things that you try and do. If I get 20 minutes...I might be able to tell him."

252.title: Zoho to hire 2,000 people as it looks to expand globally
252.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Zoho is planning to hire 2,000 people across various roles in engineering, design, content and sales as it looks to expand its operations in India and globally. Speaking to Economic Times, Prashant Ganti, head of products, tax, accounting and payroll at Zoho, said that the company plans to grow organically and expand to other geographies.

253.title: iVOOMi Energy to set up Electric Vehicle manufacturing unit in Pune
253.article_body: iVOOMi Energy will set up an Electric Vehicle manufacturing unit in Pune with a ₹200 crore investment to enhance research and development. iVOOMi Energy aims to roll out more than 2,00,000 units by the end of FY23. The manufacturing plant will be operational from March 2023, and will provide employment to 2,000 people, the company said in a statement.

254.title: Nearly half of EU territory at drought risk as Europe braces heatwave
254.article_body: Nearly half of EU's territory is at risk of drought, the European Commission said on Monday as several parts of the continent are currently bracing heatwaves. EU researchers have also warned that lack of water and strong heat are driving crop yields lower in France, Romania, Spain, Portugal and Italy. Notably, Italy's longest river Po has significantly shrunk in size.

255.title: General Aeronautics commences commercial production of agri drones
255.article_body: Drone startup General Aeronautics has started the commercial production of agriculture drones with an aim to produce 100 units monthly. The startup had been conducting trials for the last three years, the results of which have been validated by 15 agricultural institutes, Srikanth Srinivasan, Head of Sales and Marketing, General Aeronautics said. The manufactured drone is named 'Krishak.'

256.title: BJP MP pledges salary to family of Udaipur tailor, gets death threat
256.article_body: BJP MP from Rajasthan Kirodi Lal Meena on Monday said that he has received a death threat via a letter for pledging his one month's salary to the family of Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal. The letter says that whoever insults the Prophet or helps those insulting the Prophet will be killed, even if they are big leaders.

257.title: This Indian bowling unit is excellent: Siraj after ODI series win vs England
257.article_body: Speaking about India's bowling performance in the recently concluded three-match ODI series against England, pacer Mohammed Siraj stated that the current Indian bowling unit is excellent. "Like how Hardik Pandya came in and took the wickets of their well-set batters [in third ODI], that phase was really crucial for...team," he added. India bowled out England in all three ODIs.

258.title: UK residents asked to stay indoors as temp expected to breach 40°C
258.article_body: People in the UK are being advised to stay indoors and avoid non-essential travel as the country may experience temperatures above 40°C on Monday or Tuesday for the first time since records began. The advisory comes as the country has issued its first-ever red alert for extreme heat amid unprecedented temperatures. Notably, several regions in Europe are experiencing heatwaves.

259.title: Hardik Pandya shares video of his journey from injury rehab to India comeback
259.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to social media to share a video of his journey from injury rehab to Team India comeback. He wrote, "Through the ups and downs...with my people by my side. Woke up every morning raring to go...with the will to become fitter and play for my country. Always grateful to those who stood by me."

260.title: Rail Ministry shares before-after pics of Gauriganj Station, says 'Glimpse of new India'
260.article_body: The Ministry of Railways took to Twitter to share before-after pictures of Gauriganj Station, which is situated in Uttar Pradesh. "Glimpse of new India: Gauriganj Station," the ministry wrote alongside the tweet. "Superb," a user commented on the post. The station is located in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi district.

261.title: Veteran Bollywood singer Bhupinder Singh passes away at 82
261.article_body: Veteran Bollywood playback and ghazal singer Bhupinder Singh has passed away of a colon ailment at 82 in Mumbai. Singh is known for songs like 'Naam Gum Jayega', 'Kabhi Kisi Ko Mukammal Jahan Nahi Milta' and 'Hothon Pe Aisi Baat'. He's also been credited as a guitarist in famous Bollywood songs like 'Dum Maro Dum' and 'Mehbooba O Mehbooba'.

262.title: Precaution dose needed as protection is declining: COVID task force
262.article_body: National Task Force on COVID-19 head Dr VK Paul on Monday said the precaution dose of the vaccine is needed as the protection against the virus is declining. "We need to have optimal protection beyond six months of second dose. The precaution dose must be pushed in mission mode," he said. Paul added that there is fatigue in people's mind.

263.title: West can't isolate Russia & reverse its development by decades: Putin
263.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that it's impossible for the West to isolate Russia from the rest of the world and reverse the country's development back by "decades". Putin added that Russia will have to develop its own domestic technology. Western countries, including the US and UK, imposed several financial sanctions on Russia following its invasion of Ukraine.

264.title: PM Modi-led govt's faulty policies reason for inflation: Kharge
264.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that PM Narendra Modi-led government's "faulty policies" are the reason behind the rising inflation in the country. Criticising the high food prices and retail inflation, Kharge said it showed "how little the Modi government cares for the poor". He further called the step to hike GST rates as "anti-poor and insensitive".

265.title: Stay alert: Uttarakhand CM to officials amid heavy rainfall alert
265.article_body: In view of the Indian Meteorological Department's (IMD) heavy rainfall forecast for Uttarakhand, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has asked all District Magistrates to be on high alert. He also appealed to tourists and citizens to stay away from rivers and rivulets to avoid accidents. The IMD has issued a red alert in seven districts of the state for July 20.

266.title: 2 killed, 3 injured while making crude bombs in West Bengal's Murshidabad
266.article_body: Two men were killed and three others were injured in an explosion on Monday morning while they were making crude bombs in West Bengal's Murshidabad district. The deceased have been identified by the police. This comes within 48 hours of a similar incident reported in Malda district wherein three men died after the crude bombs they were making accidentally exploded.

267.title: Plane flips over & crash-lands at Somalia airport, passengers safe
267.article_body: A passenger plane carrying over 30 people crash-landed at an airport in Somalia's Mogadishu on Monday. No fatalities were reported and all those on board were rescued. The aircraft, which belongs to Jubba Airways, reportedly flipped upside down upon landing and burst into flames, which was doused by fire brigade officials. The cause of the crash, however, isn't known yet.

268.title: Scientists discover 1st dormant black hole outside Milky Way, share illustration
268.article_body: Scientists have discovered a dormant black hole outside the Milky Way galaxy. They have claimed that it is the first dormant stellar-mass black hole to have been detected outside of the Milky Way galaxy. The black hole that has been found is at least nine times the mass of the Sun and is 1,60,000 light years from Earth.

269.title: NEET aspirants allegedly made to remove burkha, hijab at exam centres
269.article_body: Two Muslim girls were allegedly made to remove their burkha and hijab at the examination centre to appear for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) in Maharashtra’s Washim, police said. The incident allegedly occurred at Matoshree Shantabai Gote College. As per the  complaint, the staff checking students made objectionable remarks including threatening to cut the burkha and hijab.

270.title: Negotiations with IMF for bailout nearing completion: SL acting Prez
270.article_body: Sri Lankan acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Monday that negotiations with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to secure a bailout package amid the country's ongoing economic crisis is nearing conclusion. He added that discussions for assistance with foreign countries were also progressing. July will be a difficult month in terms of securing fuel supply, Wickremesinghe further said.

271.title: Dosa sold as 'Naked Crepe' for ₹1,400 by US restaurant, Indian Twitter users react
271.article_body: A Twitter user posted a menu of an American restaurant which showed dosas being sold as 'Naked Crepe' and 'Smashed Potato Crepe' for around $18 (over ₹1,400). It also showed Medu Vada as 'Dunked Donut'. "Why can't they use the original names?" asked a Twitter user. "I've never been this pissed just by looking at a menu," said another.

272.title: When will fire safety regulations be implemented: Bombay HC to Maha govt
272.article_body: The Bombay High Court has asked the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government to report the progress of implementing regulations for fire safety in buildings vulnerable to man-made disasters within a week. This comes after a PIL raised a grievance saying that regulations were formulated in 2009 in the aftermath of the 26/11 terror attacks but nothing was done to implement them.

273.title: Swedish fashion retailer H&M to exit Russia amid Ukraine war
273.article_body: Swedish fashion retailer H&M said that it will exit from Russia after pausing sales there in March after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "After careful consideration, we see it as impossible given the current situation to continue our business in Russia," Chief Executive Helena Helmersson said in a statement. H&M said the move will cost $200 million and affect 6,000 staff.

274.title: Italian PM visits Algeria for deal to replace Russian gas imports
274.article_body: Italian PM Mario Draghi reached Algiers on Monday to finalise agreements with Algeria that will allow the country to replace Russia as Italy's main gas supplier. An agreement to increase gas supply to Italy by 40% was reached between the two countries in April. This comes as Europe faces a possible stoppage of Russian gas supply over the Ukraine conflict.

275.title: Presidential polls witness 98.91% turnout at Parliament House
275.article_body: The polling for the 16th Presidential election was conducted on Monday commencing at 10 am and closing at 5 pm. As per the Rajya Sabha Secretariat, out of the 736 electors comprising 727 MPs and 9 Legislative Assembly members, 728 electors cast their votes which consists of 719 MPs and 9 MLAs. The total turnout was 98.91% at Parliament House.

276.title: 52nd India-Bangladesh DG-level border conference begins in Dhaka
276.article_body: Indian and Bangladeshi delegations led by chiefs of BSF and Border Guards Bangladesh respectively met in Dhaka on Monday to commence the 52nd Director General-level border conference between the two nations. Issue of cross-border crimes and future challenges will be discussed during the conference. It will conclude with the signing of a joint record of discussion, an official said.

277.title: Bernie Sanders slams Biden's meeting with Saudi crown prince
277.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders on Sunday criticised President Joe Biden's meeting with Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman during his recent visit to Saudi Arabia. Sanders said he believes that a country whose leader ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi should not be "rewarded with a visit by the President of the United States".

278.title: Govt advises screening of foreign arrivals as India sees 2 monkeypox cases
278.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Monday advised strict health screening of all international passengers on arrival to minimise the risk of importation of monkeypox infections. This comes after the country's second positive case of monkeypox was confirmed in Kerala's Kannur district. India's first confirmed monkeypox case was also reported in Kerala on July 14.

279.title: PM Modi to interact with Indian contingent bound for CWG on July 20
279.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will interact with 2022 Commonwealth Games-bound Indian contingent on July 20, Wednesday, via video conferencing, his office said on Monday. The interaction will be attended by both athletes as well as their coaches. CWG will be held in Birmingham from July 28 to August 8. A total of 215 athletes will be participating in the event.

280.title: Woman fired from her new higher-paying job after revealing salary on TikTok in US
280.article_body: An American woman said she was fired from her new higher-paying job after her employer discovered she disclosed her salary in a TikTok video. Lexi Larson said her salary increased from $70,000 to $90,000 when she switched from accounting to a tech role and posted about how she got the job. Her employer said her TikTok was a "safety concern".

281.title: Hardik was fluent in his innings, took pressure off Pant: Zaheer on 3rd ODI
281.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for his batting in India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI, Zaheer Khan said the India all-rounder was fluent in his innings and took the pressure off Rishabh Pant by batting at a healthy strike rate. Hardik, who scored a 55-ball 71 at a strike rate of 129.09, stitched a 133-run fifth-wicket partnership with Pant(125*).

282.title: Who are David Beckham and Ronaldo Singh, who will represent India at CWG 2022?
282.article_body: David Beckham and Ronaldo Singh Laitonjam are among the athletes who'll represent India at upcoming CWG 2022. Both are professional cyclists. Beckham is 19 years old and hails from Andaman, while 19-year-old Ronaldo hails from Manipur. David got the name as his maternal uncle was a big fan of ex-England footballer David Beckham, while Ronaldo's name is inspired from Ronaldinho.

283.title: Woman kills 1-yr-old son after argument with husband in UP
283.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her one-year-old son after an argument with her husband in UP, police said on Monday. The accused, along with her husband and son, lived in Mumbai but had returned to UP earlier in July, police added. The woman killed her son after an argument over returning to Mumbai with her husband, the accused's husband alleged.

284.title: Wife of Afghan man who worked with British army denied entry to UK
284.article_body: The wife of an Afghan man who worked with the British army as an interpreter has been denied entry to the UK. The woman's husband, Hafizullah Husseinkhel, who fled to the UK from Afghanistan in 2014 after receiving death threats from the Taliban, said he feels "betrayed" by the decision. The woman is currently residing in a hotel in Pakistan.

285.title: Attempts of forces to harm India’s interests must be thwarted: PM
285.article_body: Attempts of forces to harm the country's interests must be thwarted effectively, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday while highlighting the need for a "whole-of-government approach" to combat myriad national security challenges. PM also spoke about the weapons the Indian Army will possess and said, "My jawans will have what the opponent won't even think of."

286.title: Shooting of Shanaya's 'Bedhadak' to commence next year: Karan Johar
286.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram to announce that the shooting for 'Bedhadak' featuring Shanaya Kapoor, Gurfateh Singh Pirzada and Lakshya is set to commence next year. This comes after reports surfaced stating that the film has been shelved. As per the makers' official statement, the actors are currently reading scripts and undergoing workshops for the upcoming film.

287.title: La Ganesan takes oath as Bengal Guv as Dhankhar nominated for Vice-Prez poll
287.article_body: Manipur Governor La Ganesan on Monday took oath as the new Governor of West Bengal after the resignation of Jagdeep Dhankhar, who has been nominated as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate. Ganesan has been given the additional charge of West Bengal. CM Mamata Banerjee welcomed him by presenting him with a flower bouquet after the swearing-in ceremony.

288.title: Uddhav fires Sena leaders for 'anti-party' acts, Maha CM adds them to his faction
288.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday sacked several Shiv Sena leaders, including former state minister Ramdas Kadam and senior party leader Anandrao Vithoba Adsul for anti-party activities. CM Eknath Shinde has reportedly appointed them as leaders of a new 'National Executive Committee'. Shinde also reportedly elected party MLA Deepak Kesarkar as chief spokesperson of the committee.

289.title: My jawans will have what the opponent won't even think of: PM
289.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said, "It's not smart to let my soldiers go to the field with the same 10 weapons that the world has...My jawans will have what the opponent won't even think of." He was speaking at the naval summit in Delhi. PM Modi added 'aatmanirbharta' in defence is very crucial for the India of 21st century.

290.title: Didn't realise we were making memories: Juhi on 25 years of 'Yes Boss'
290.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla shared a video montage of scenes from her film 'Yes Boss' on social media to celebrate 25 years since its release. She wrote alongside the video, "I didn't realise we were making memories...No words to thank the 'Yes Boss' team enough...for making such a lovely film watched by millions even today." The film co-stars Shah Rukh Khan.

291.title: Superstar in every format: ECB interim CEO on Stokes after his ODI retirement
291.article_body: After Ben Stokes announced his retirement from ODI cricket, England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) interim CEO Clare Connor said the England all-rounder is a superstar in every format. "His remarkable contribution to...World Cup final at Lord's in 2019 enabled England men to win that prestigious trophy for...first time," she added. Stokes will play his last ODI on Tuesday.

292.title: Nupur Sharma moves SC again, says 'got rape & death threats after SC criticism'
292.article_body: Suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma has moved the Supreme Court (SC) again to club the various FIRs filed against her over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad. She said she received "renewed" rape and death threats after SC's "unexpected and harsh criticism" of her earlier. The plea will be heard tomorrow by Justices Surya Kant and JB Pardiwala who'd criticised her.

293.title: Imran Khan seeks fresh general polls in Pak after Punjab bypoll win
293.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan has sought fresh general elections in Pakistan after his party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) won 16 out of 20 seats in Punjab assembly bypolls. The results come as a setback for PM Shehbaz Sharif's son Hamza Shahbaz, who will now lose his designation as Punjab CM. Imran Khan was ousted as PM in April via no-trust vote.

294.title: India's defence imports have come down by 21%: PM at naval seminar
294.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at naval seminar on Monday said India's defence imports have come down by about 21% in the last four-five years. "We are developing new defence ecosystem in India," PM Modi added. He said, "In last eight years, we increased defence budget and also ensured it was useful in development of defence manufacturing ecosystem in India."

295.title: It was like rollercoaster of emotions: Sindhu after winning Singapore Open
295.article_body: Taking to Twitter after winning her first Singapore Open title, PV Sindhu wrote, "It was like a rollercoaster of emotions but managed to pull through and win the championship!" She added, "Always special to win in Singapore. Time for a much needed breather before the big one in Birmingham." It was world number seven Sindhu's third title of the year.

296.title: Kohli should leave excess baggage back in England, start afresh: Ojha
296.article_body: Pragyan Ojha said India batter Virat Kohli should leave the "excess baggage" back in England and start afresh. "He's going through a bad phase. What he can do is cut short...negativity," he added. Against England in rescheduled fifth Test, Kohli scored 11 and 20. While he managed 12 runs in two T20Is, he hit 16 and 17 in two ODIs.

297.title: Sequoia, Tiger Global led startup funding in India in Apr-Jun: Nasscom
297.article_body: Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global were the leading Venture Capital firms that invested in Indian startups between April-June in 2022, as per a report by industry body Nasscom. Both the companies invested majorly in the fintech and enterprise technology domain. Tiger Global and Sequoia Capital made 60% of investments in the growth stage of the startups.

298.title: Sanjay Nayar's maiden tech fund Sorin raises $100 mn
298.article_body: Sorin Investments, a tech fund co-founded by private equity veteran Sanjay Nayar and Hong Kong-based Caravel Group's Angad Banga has raised $100 million in its first close. Speaking to Mint, Nayar and Banga said that the fund will aim to raise $130 million. The funding saw participation from KKR Co-founder Henry Kravis and Hero Enterprise Chairman Sunil Kant Munjal.

299.title: Assam student arrested for supporting ULFA-I; 2nd arrest in 2 months
299.article_body: A 22-year-old college student has been arrested in Assam's Udalguri district for allegedly supporting the banned United Liberation Front of Asom-Independent (ULFA-I) online, officials said on Monday. The accused, Pramod Kalita, has been remanded to judicial custody. Kalita's arrest comes nearly two months after a 19-year-old girl was arrested in Uriamghat for posting "anti-national" poem online.

300.title: A farmer's son filed nomination today, grateful to PM Modi: Dhankhar
300.article_body: Shortly after filing his nomination, NDA's VP candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar said that a farmer's son filed his nomination and expressed his gratitude to PM Narendra Modi for giving him the opportunity. "Not even in my dreams did I think that a common man like me would be given such an opportunity," Dhankhar said.

301.title: Ola Electric to open Asia's largest battery innovation centre
301.article_body: Ola Electric will invest $500 million to set up Asia's largest battery innovation centre in Bengaluru, CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted. The company's Research and Development facility will employ over 500 engineers and PhDs, and will be up and running by next month. The tweet, accompanied by a video, gives details and a virtual glimpse of the upcoming centre.

302.title: Man who killed minor girl in WB five years ago held in Mumbai
302.article_body: A man who escaped West Bengal after allegedly killing a minor girl five years ago was held from Mumbai's Malwani, a police official said on Monday. The accused had killed the 8-year-old girl in the Kaliganj area of WB and had been on the run since, the official added. He was arrested from a garment factory, the official further said.

303.title: Girls asked to remove bras at NEET exam centre in Kerala, complaint filed
303.article_body: Parents have alleged that their daughters were told to remove their innerwear before taking the medical entrance NEET 2022 at an exam centre in Kerala's Kollam on Sunday. The students were allegedly asked to remove bras because of their metal hooks and underwires. A parent filed a police complaint saying, "[My daughter] returned to us crying, distressed."

304.title: Virat Kohli reacts to Ben Stokes' ODI retirement, calls him 'Most competitive bloke'
304.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli reacted to England Test captain Ben Stokes announcing his retirement from ODI cricket. "You're the most competitive bloke I've ever played against. Respect," Kohli commented on Stokes' post on Instagram. Stokes said that he will play his last ODI on Tuesday against South Africa.

305.title: BJP leader Sultana Khan attacked by 2 bike-borne assailants in Mumbai
305.article_body: Two bike-borne assailants attacked BJP's minority wing (women) state president Sultana Khan in Mumbai on Sunday night. "Before leaving, the assailants said that this was just a token and that what you're doing is not right. Mend your ways else, we will finish you and your family," Khan's husband said. The accused attacked Khan with a sharp-edged weapon, he added.

306.title: Automobile thief arrested in Hyd, 8 motorcycles recovered
306.article_body: The Commissioner's Task Force, South Zone Team, Hyderabad, along with Asifnagar Police arrested an automobile thief and seized eight two-wheelers worth ₹5 lakh. The accused had a fascination for riding bikes, reports said. However, his earnings were not enough to fulfil his desires, so the accused started stealing motorcycles. The accused was released from jail in April 2022, reports said.

307.title: She's the last person to check bank balances, I was penniless: Sushmita's ex Vikram Bhatt
307.article_body: Talking about Sushmita Sen being called a 'gold digger' for dating Lalit Modi, her ex-boyfriend Vikram Bhatt said, "Sushmita is a love digger, not a gold digger." "Sushmita is the last person who checks...bank balances before she decides to fall in love with someone. I was penniless. I was directing Ghulam, but I had no money," he added.

308.title: 1 LDF, 2 Congress leaders temporarily put on IndiGo's no-fly list
308.article_body: IndiGo has put Kerala's ruling Left Democratic Front (LDF) convener EP Jayarajan and two Congress workers on its no-fly list for specific periods for their role in a scuffle on the aircraft that was also carrying CM Pinarayi Vijayan last month. Reacting to the ban, Jayarajan said, "It's a huge insult." He added that he will boycott the airline forever.

309.title: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low of 212 against US dollar
309.article_body: The Pakistani rupee has dropped to a record low against the US dollar with the exchange rate sliding to PKR 212, local media reported on Monday. This fall in the value came after traders resorted to panic buying on reports that some commercial banks had run out of foreign currency, reports stated.

310.title: West Indies announce their 13-member squad for ODI series against India
310.article_body: West Indies have announced their 13-member squad for the ODI series against India, which will begin on July 22. Senior all-rounder Jason Holder has been recalled to West Indies' squad, which will be led by Nicholas Pooran. Shai Hope will be West Indies' vice captain. Romario Shepherd and Hayden Walsh Jr have been named as reserve players.

311.title: 5 held for running recruitment scam from fake call centre in Delhi
311.article_body: Five members of a gang involved in over 300 cheating cases were arrested for running a fake call centre in Delhi's Shahdara and cheating people on pretext of providing them airline jobs. Accused would acquire job seekers' information from recruitment website, police said. They were arrested after a man filed a complaint, alleging that he was cheated of ₹6.80 lakh.

312.title: Harbhajan takes oath as Rajya Sabha member, says 'will do my best for the nation'
312.article_body: Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh has taken oath as a member of the Rajya Sabha from Punjab. Sharing a video from the ceremony in Parliament, Singh said, "Took oath...to protect the Constitution, rule of law and dignity of the House. I will do my best for the people of Punjab and the nation..Jai Hind Jai Bharat." He was nominated by AAP.

313.title: Rape accused suspended Hyderabad Inspector sent to police custody
313.article_body: Suspended Hyderabad Police Inspector Nageshwar Rao who is accused of raping a woman was remanded to police custody by a local court on Monday. Vanasthalipuram Police had sought Rao's custody for investigation into the case. Upon grant of custody, Rao was brought to Vanasthalipuram police station from Central Prison Cherlapally by a police team.

314.title: Cough syrup bottles worth ₹1 crore seized in Guwahati, 2 held
314.article_body: Guwahati Police has busted an interstate drugs network and seized a consignment containing 20,000 cough syrup bottles worth over ₹1 crore from a truck, officials said on Monday. The truck was intercepted in Assam's Gorchuk area and the consignment was being transported by truck from Punjab to Manipur. Two persons have been arrested in connection with the bust.

315.title: SC to hear plea seeking to worship 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi premises
315.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to list for hearing a fresh plea seeking its permission to worship the 'Shivling', which is said to be found in the Gyanvapi mosque premises in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi during a court-ordered survey. A bench comprising CJI NV Ramana and Justices Krishna Murari and Hima Kohli posted the matter for hearing on July 21.

316.title: Nearly all B'luru COVID-19 cases were Omicron by Jan end: Study
316.article_body: A study by a genomics-based research company suggests that nearly 100% of COVID-19 cases reported by the end of January 2022 in Bengaluru were driven by Omicron and its sub-lineages. Nearly 30 sub-lineages of the variant were identified, the study said. The study also found that Delta sub-lineages were dominant from July 2021 to October 2021.

317.title: Policeman shoots dead 3 colleagues in Delhi, later surrenders
317.article_body: A policeman posted at the water plant in the Haiderpur area of Delhi shot dead his three colleagues on Monday. The accused and the three victims were from Sikkim Police and they were deployed at the plant for its security as part of the India Reserve Battalion. The accused surrendered at the Samaypur Badli police station, an official said.

318.title: Samantha to be guest at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2022
318.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu will be a key guest at the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. The actress will be speaking about her own career and trajectory on August 13 before a live audience. The festival will be holding both physical and virtual events after being online for the past two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic and lockdown.

319.title: Man kills live-in partner over money dispute in Delhi, arrested
319.article_body: A 43-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly murdering his live-in partner at their house in Delhi, police said. The accused allegedly strangled the victim to death following an altercation between them over lending money to a neighbour, police said. The accused, along with two others who were also arrested, dumped the victim's body near Yamuna Expressway.

320.title: Run machine, legend-in-the-making: KKR on Smriti Mandhana's 26th birthday
320.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders took to Twitter to wish India Women limited-overs vice-captain Smriti Mandhana on her 26th birthday on Monday. "A run machine and a legend-in-the-making!" wrote KKR. Mumbai Indians tweeted, "Wishing one of the most gifted batters, Smriti, a very happy birthday from one family." Smriti has scored 5,250 runs in 165 international matches so far.

321.title: Period films harder, the world needs to be believable: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
321.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor stated in an interview that period films like 'Shamshera' are harder because the world it is set in needs to be believable. "Audience...need to know the place and time, they can't be alienated from that. So it's quite tricky," he added. The actor further said that if the story is engaging and entertaining, that's what matters.

322.title: Poor being maligned with talk of 'revadi culture': Priyanka Gandhi
322.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi, saying that the poor and middle class were being maligned with the talk of "revadi culture", while others were earning indiscriminately. "Earlier, petrol-diesel, cooking gas were made expensive. Today, flour, cereals, and curd have also become expensive," Gandhi said. Electricity will also get expensive soon, she added.

323.title: Pleasing to see them dominate on English soil: Laxman on India's 2-1 ODIs win
323.article_body: After India's 2-1 win in the three-match ODI series against England, VVS Laxman said it is very pleasing to see India dominate on English soil. "A fantastic chase to win the ODI series...partnership between Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya was a phenomenal comeback," he added. Sachin Tendulkar said, "Congratulations to Team India...keep up the good work and continue this form."

324.title: Fitness certificate of bus that fell into river in MP was to expire soon
324.article_body: The Maharashtra road transport bus that fell into the Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Monday was over 10 years old and its fitness certificate was to expire in about 10 days, RTO officials said. At least 12 passengers were killed in the accident. The bus was on its way to Jalgaon district in Maharashtra.

325.title: Hoax bomb threat sent to B'luru school owned by DK Shivakumar
325.article_body: Bengaluru's National Hill View Public School, owned by Congress leader DK Shivakumar, on Monday received a bomb threat that turned out to be a hoax upon a thorough police search. A bomb squad and sniffer dogs were deployed for inspection of the premises, an official said. Shivakumar had suggested the possibility of the threat being a hoax in the morning.

326.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an excellent, inspiring VP: PM Modi
326.article_body: Shortly after NDA Vice Presidential candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar filed his nomination on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that he will be an excellent and inspiring VP. JP Nadda said Dhankhar is a "Kisan-Putra" (son of a farmer) who has established himself as a "people's governor". I will always strive to enhance the democratic values of India, Dhankhar said.

327.title: Shia group seeks ₹5 cr for renovation of Ashoorkhanas in Hyderabad
327.article_body: Ahead of Muharram, a Shia group has sought a special grant of ₹5 crore from the Telangana Minorities Welfare Ministry for repairs and renovation of Ashoorkhanas (places of mourning). The grant is sought for repairs in Hyderabad and other districts of Telangana. Muharram processions will be taken out in Hyderabad on August 8 and August 9.

328.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra's remand extended by 4 days in money laundering case
328.article_body: A Delhi court has extended the four-day remand of former CEO and MD of National Stock Exchange (NSE), Chitra Ramkrishna, in a money laundering case. The case involves alleged phone tapping and snooping of NSE's employees. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate and CBI registered two more cases against Ramkrishna, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey.

329.title: Governor office neither ornamental nor political: Vice President Naidu
329.article_body: Outgoing Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday stated that the office of a Governor is "neither an ornamental position nor a political position". He appealed the Governors to ensure that programs funded by the Centre are properly implemented by the states. Governors' conduct should set an example, a media release from Naidu's office quoted him as saying.

330.title: Margaret Alva is a better VP candidate than Dhankhar: Kharge
330.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that the Opposition candidate, Margaret Alva, for the Vice-President elections is a better one than the NDA candidate, Jagdeep Dhankhar. "Our candidate is from the minority and is better than their candidate. If they will support our candidate [Margaret Alva], then it will be a unanimous poll," Kharge said.

331.title: Ben Stokes retires from ODI cricket, says '3 formats are just unsustainable for me now'
331.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes has announced his retirement from ODI cricket, saying England's match against South Africa on Tuesday will be his last ODI. "Three formats are just unsustainable for me now," he stated. "It's time for someone else to progress as a cricketer and make incredible memories like I have over the past 11 years," he added.

332.title: Russia instructs its forces to destroy Ukraine's long-range weapons
332.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has instructed the military's Vostok group's commander to prioritise destroying Ukraine's long-range missile and artillery weapons and "continue...intentional incineration of wheat fields," the Russian Defence Ministry said on Monday. Shoigu said that these weapons were being used to "shell residential areas" in the Russia-controlled Donbas region, it added.

333.title: Karnataka fits radio collars on 2 elephants to reduce human-animal conflicts
333.article_body: The Karnataka government's forest department has fitted radio collars on two elephants in MM Hills Wildlife Sanctuary to prevent human-animal conflicts in the nearby areas. A radio collar is a belt equipped with GPS and its real-time monitoring will send early warnings to forest staff. "We have received complaints that two tuskers often enter the village areas," an official said.

334.title: Company supervisor assaulted, robbed after taking shared cab in Gurugram
334.article_body: A private company's supervisor was allegedly assaulted and robbed by three men after the former took a shared cab from Gurugram's Vatika Chowk to Mathura. The accused took a detour and started beating the victim, Ramesh Kumar (45), before snatching two mobile phones and ₹29,000 cash from him, police said. The complaint was lodged at the Badshahpur Police Station.

335.title: Jharkhand woman kills husband for not allowing her to wear jeans
335.article_body: A woman killed her husband in Jharkhand's Jamtara after he allegedly stopped her from wearing jeans after marriage. The woman, Pushpa Hembrom, had an argument with her husband after she went to see a fair wearing jeans. She allegedly attacked him with knife during argument, leaving the victim grievously injured. He was rushed to hospital and later succumbed to injuries.

336.title: MP doctor, gunman frisk patients to seize tobacco; people say ‘inhuman act’
336.article_body: The civil surgeon of the Shahdol district hospital in Madhya Pradesh, while being escorted by a gunman and stick-wielding guards, frisked patients and their attendants to allegedly seize tobacco. Reports said that some people termed the act "inhuman". The surgeon said that this was being done to stop the patients from chewing tobacco and spitting in the hospital.

337.title: Yellow alert issued in Mumbai on Monday, water stock in lakes at 82%
337.article_body: IMD issued a yellow alert in Mumbai on Monday, even as the rain subsided in most parts of the state over the weekend. However, the water stock in lakes because of heavy rain is now at 82%, with three lakes having already overflowed. Furthermore, two more rain-related deaths were reported on Sunday, taking the season's total to 104 in Maharashtra.

338.title: 20 trains on Mumbai-Delhi route cancelled after train derails in Guj
338.article_body: 20 trains on the Mumbai-Delhi route have been cancelled and about 16 trains diverted after a goods train derailed on Monday in Gujarat. According to Western Railway, wagons of the goods train that were meant to transport coal were running empty when they overturned. Eyewitnesses told police and railway officials that the wagons derailed with a deafening noise.

339.title: Droupadi Murmu will win Prez polls by a huge margin: Karnataka CM
339.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will win the polls by a "huge majority". "There is every possibility of Murmu breaking all previous records in her margin of victory. Murmu is the personification of noble humane values," CM Bommai said. "Murmu has received support from several [non-NDA] parties too," he added.

340.title: ED questions Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
340.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife, Poonam Jain, in connection with a money laundering case. Earlier, Poonam was summoned by the ED on July 14. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

341.title: Rare white whale washes up on a beach in Australia, pic surfaces
341.article_body: A rare white whale washed up on a Victorian beach in Australia. Several people believed the whale that washed up to be the famous humpback Migaloo, which was first spotted off Byron Bay in 1991. However, the local environment department confirmed that it isn't Migaloo. Officials confirmed that the white whale is a sub-adult female, while Migaloo is a male.

342.title: Compensate COVID victims' families without wasting time: SC to states
342.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday asked all states and Union Territories to pay compensation to the family members of COVID-19 victims without wasting any time. The court said that if any claimant has a grievance, they may approach the grievance redressal committee. The committee will have to decide the application of the claimant within four weeks.

343.title: Fortune cooking oil prices cut by up to ₹30 per litre by Adani Wilmar
343.article_body: Prices of one of the most popular Indian edible oil brands Fortune have been cut by up to ₹30 per litre amid a fall in global prices. This is the second oil price reduction announced by the brand's maker Adani Wilmar in two months. Prices of soyabean and sunflower oils have been cut to ₹165 and ₹195 per litre, respectively.

344.title: Deepika Padukone to play Parvati in 'Brahmastra 2': Report
344.article_body: Deepika Padukone will portray Parvati in 'Brahmastra 2', according to a report. The actress will reportedly also make a cameo appearance in 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', which is set to release in theatres on September 9. The upcoming film, starring Ranbir Kapoor, Amitabh Bachchan, Alia Bhatt and Nagarjuna Akkineni, will be released in multiple languages.

345.title: In a first, Cong fought Gwalior civic polls without Scindia and won: Digvijaya
345.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Digvijaya Singh has commented on Congress winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation on Sunday. "For the first time, Congress fought the Gwalior local body polls without [Congress-turned BJP leader] Jyotiraditya Scindia and won it," Digvijaya said. He added, "This win should be noted by political observers." Notably, Scindia belongs to the Gwalior-based royal family.

346.title: Leopard rushed to police station after people climb cage for selfies in Gujarat
346.article_body: A caged leopard had to be rushed to the police station 10 km away after locals climbed on the cage and started taking selfies and videos of it in Gujarat. People rushed in large numbers to see the leopard and forest officials had a tough time controlling the mob. We covered the cage but public continued taking videos, officials said.

347.title: Rajesh Khanna was very generous, he bought houses for co-stars: Sharmila
347.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore, who appeared with Rajesh Khanna in multiple films, has revealed that the late actor used to buy expensive gifts for his co-actors, colleagues and friends. "I have seen him be very generous...Sometimes he even bought them a house but in return, it seems Kaka had great expectations of them, which eventually strained his relations," Sharmila added.

348.title: Love you SRK for rehearsing with me, not throwing attitude: Kashmera on 'Yes..'
348.article_body: Actress Kashmera Shah took to Instagram to share a video from 'Yes Boss' and thanked actor Shah Rukh Khan for his support. "Today I completed 25 years in the Bollywood film industry...Thank you King Khan for putting me at comfort...Love you always for rehearsing with me and not throwing attitude of being the huge star that you were," she wrote.
