349.title: COVID-19 outbreak at resort in China leaves 2,000 stranded
349.article_body: Over 2,000 tourists are stranded in the city of Beihai in China's Guangxi region after over 450 people tested positive for coronavirus over five days at a resort there, state media Global Times reported. Of the total, 444 were asymptomatic, according to a press briefing. The city is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Guangxi, the report said.

350.title: B'luru parks to remain open for extra hours following public demand
350.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the timings of all parks within its limits by two and a half hours and now they will remain open from 5 am to 8 pm. Earlier, the parks used to open only from 5 am to 10 am and 4 pm to 8 pm. The decision was taken following public demand.

351.title: Convict who escaped Pune jail by removing roof tiles rearrested
351.article_body: Pune Rural Police have rearrested a 22-year-old convict who had fled from the Shirur police station last month. The accused, identified as Rohan Biru Sontakke, who is reportedly a history-sheeter, escaped after removing the roof tiles of the washroom attached to the lockup in the wee hours of June 23. Police nabbed Sontakke on Saturday after receiving a tip-off.

352.title: We're not getting to spend as much time together as I'd want: Janhvi on family
352.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said in an interview that she would love to do a film with her actor-brother Arjun Kapoor. "We're all working so much, we're not getting to spend as much time together as a family as I'd want us to," she said, adding, "So I think the only way...to get...family together is to...do a film and cast everyone in...family."

353.title: I'd have definitely tried to hit another one: Sehwag on Pant's 5 consecutive fours
353.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant smashed five consecutive fours off England pacer David Willey in the 42nd over in their final ODI on Sunday. Reacting to it, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "I'd have definitely tried to hit [another] four or a six." India needed four runs to win off Willey's last delivery but Pant took a single.

354.title: When it was time to give relief, we burdened people: Varun on new GST rate
354.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi criticised the central government over the latest increase in GST rates and said that when it was time to give people "relief", we are burdening them. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "This decision, taken amid record-breaking unemployment, will further lighten the pockets of middle-class families and especially the struggling youth living in rented houses."

355.title: Helicopter returning after helping firefighters crashes in US; 4 dead
355.article_body: Four people died after a helicopter of Bernalillo County Sheriff's Office crashed near Las Vegas in US' New Mexico while it was returning after helping firefighters in another city in the state, authorities said on Sunday. The deceased include three personnel from the sheriff's office and one county firefighter. The cause of the incident is unknown and will be investigated.

356.title: Asked Musk how many kids he plans to have, he said 'Mars needs people': Mark Cuban
356.article_body: Billionaire Mark Cuban said that he once asked Elon Musk how many children he planned on having. "This was before the last three or whatever it was," Cuban said, likely referring to the three children Musk fathered in 2021. "I'm like, 'Dude, congratulations, how many you going to have?' He sends me a text back, 'Mars needs people'," Cuban recalled.

357.title: Solar storm to hit Earth tomorrow, may cause radio & GPS disruptions
357.article_body: A solar flare or solar storm that erupted from the Sun on July 14 is expected to hit Earth and disrupt radio and GPS signals early on July 19, experts have warned. Space weather expert Dr Tamitha Skov said that strong aurora or polar lights will also possibly be seen on Earth due to the solar storm.

358.title: Want to show people I'm more than simple, innocent: Janhvi on 'Good...'
358.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said 'Good Luck Jerry' is a good opportunity to show people that she is more than simple, innocent and helpless. "I saw the original film...thought it was cool and funny...Nayanthara was just such a bada** in the film," she stated. Janhvi added, "Nayanthara in that film was...innocent and simple, but her character had a solid arc."

359.title: Rupee closes at an all-time low of 79.98 against US dollar
359.article_body: The rupee on Monday hit a fresh record low as it ended closer to the 80-mark to close at 79.98 against the US dollar. This was the seventh consecutive session when the rupee weakened. So far this year, the currency has weakened 7.05% against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex closed 760 points higher at 54,521 on Monday.

360.title: It's invaluable to have Hardik in Team India in white-ball cricket: Jaffer
360.article_body: Wasim Jaffer has said it's invaluable to have all-rounder Hardik Pandya in the Indian team in white-ball cricket. Hardik registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4 and scored 71(55) in India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI. It was the 28-year-old's best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket. India won the three-match ODI series 2-1. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series'

361.title: That's the example you give: Zaheer on Hardik-Rishabh's 133 run partnership
361.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said the partnership between Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya in the third England ODI is the "example you'd like to give to anyone who is in the batting lineup". India were 72/4 when Hardik came in to bat alongside Pant. The duo added 133 runs for the fifth wicket, helping India win by five wickets.

362.title: HUL, ITC, United Spirits added 130 execs to crorepati club last fiscal: Report
362.article_body: Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ITC and United Spirits together added over 130 executives to the club of those earning more than ₹1 crore annually during the last fiscal, The Economic Times reported. United Spirits witnessed a massive jump of 113%, whereas HUL and ITC saw 33% and 44% increase in the number of eight-figure salary earners, as per their annual reports.

363.title: SRK's look from 'Dunki' leaked, actor spotted shooting in London
363.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's look from his upcoming film 'Dunki' has been leaked on social media. The actor was seen wearing a half-tucked plaid shirt along with black trousers and sporting a messy hair look while going for a shot on London's Waterloo Bridge. The film is directed by Rajkumar Hirani and also features Taapsee Pannu.

364.title: GST is now Gayi Saari Tankhvaah: Akhilesh criticises BJP over GST rates hike
364.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the latest hike in GST rates by coining a new term for it "Gayi Saari Tankhvaah [Gone all salary]". This new term came because of the disappointment with the increased “burden” on the earnings of common citizens due to the hike in GST rates, Yadav said.

365.title: Stopped working with Rajesh Khanna, he came at 12pm for 9am shoot: Sharmila
365.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore has revealed that the one thing about late actor Rajesh Khanna that affected her was his habit of coming late for work. The actress added that he never reached before 12pm for a 9am shift. "And that's why I decided to work with other actors despite knowing that our pairing was quite successful," Sharmila said.

366.title: BJP’s nomination of Murmu a 'masterstroke': Congress leader Rathva
366.article_body: Senior Gujarat Congress leader Sukhram Rathva on Monday said that fielding Droupadi Murmu, a tribal woman candidate for the post of President, was a "masterstroke" by the BJP.  "I hope that whoever gets elected to the post of President, he or she will implement the provisions of the Constitution," said Rathva.

367.title: BBMP collected ₹1.14 crore fine for plastic ban violations: Report
367.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike reportedly collected ₹1.14 crore in penalty for violating the single-use plastic rule between September 2019 and June 2022. On Saturday alone, the civic body seized 122.3 kg of single-use plastic from 98 locations in the city and collected ₹77,100 as a fine on the same day. Manufacturers, retailers and small-scale business vendors were among the violators.

368.title: 8 out of 13 bodies of MP bus mishap victims identified, 5 from Maharashtra
368.article_body: Authorities have identified eight out of 13 bodies of victims who lost their lives in Madhya Pradesh's bus mishap on Monday. Officials said that five of those identified belonged to Maharashtra. Two others have been traced back to Rajasthan and one to Madhya Pradesh. Bus driver and conductor are among those killed in the incident. Their bodies have been recovered.

369.title: Hyderabad student bags all-India 3rd rank in ICSE Class 10 results
369.article_body: Hyderabad's Riya Susan Tony bagged all-India third rank in ICSE Class 10 results that were declared by CISCE on Sunday evening. Riya, a student of The Future Kid's School, secured 99.4% by scoring 497 marks out of 500. The third rank is being shared by 72 candidates as all of them scored 497 marks in the Class 10 board examination.

370.title: Hardik now knows when to bowl bouncer, there's better planning: RP Singh
370.article_body: Former India pacer RP Singh has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya has improved as a bowler after coming back from his back injury. "Earlier, Hardik used to run in hard and send down short balls. But now, he thinks hard and knows when to bowl the bouncer," explained Singh. Hardik registered his career-best ODI figures of 4/24 against England.

371.title: I'm not a criminal: Kejriwal over delay in nod for Singapore visit
371.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he wasn't a "criminal", stressing that there's a "political reason" behind the delay in granting him permission to visit Singapore for a summit. Kejriwal said he was specially invited to the World Cities Summit in Singapore, where he would present the Delhi model before world leaders and bring laurels to India.

372.title: India reports its second monkeypox case in Kerala
372.article_body: India's second positive case of monkeypox has been confirmed in Kerala, the state's Health Ministry said on Monday. The case has been reported in Kerala's Kannur district, the state government said. The first case of the virus in the country was also reported in Kerala last week when a traveller from UAE tested positive.

373.title: Fraser-Pryce sets championship record in Jamaican sweep of women's 100m
373.article_body: Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce won her fifth world title in Jamaican female sprinters' clean sweep of the women's 100m in the ongoing World Athletics Championships. Fraser-Pryce won gold with a new championship record of 10.67 seconds. Shericka Jackson was second, clocking a personal best of 10.73 seconds, while the Tokyo Olympic champion Elaine Thompson-Herah finished third (10.81s).

374.title: Focussed on one ball at a time: Pant on match-winning ton vs England
374.article_body: Talking about his match-winning innings against England in third and final ODI, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said he was focussing on one ball at a time. "When your team is under pressure and you bat like that...something I aspire to do," he added. Chasing 260, Pant hit an unbeaten 125 to help India score 261/5 in 42.1 overs.

375.title: 'PS-1' director Mani Ratnam receives legal notice over Vikram's look: Report
375.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam and actor Vikram have reportedly received a legal notice from a lawyer over Vikram's look in the film 'Ponniyin Selvan'. As per the reports, the lawyer alleged Cholas didn't have a 'tilak' on the forehead. In the posters released earlier, Vikram, who plays Aditya Karikalan in the film, can be seen sporting a 'tilak'.

376.title: Grace & style of Dhanush is something to behold: Regé-Jean Page
376.article_body: Regé-Jean Page, speaking about Dhanush in 'The Gray Man', said, "The grace...style and badassery of that man, is something to behold...that's going to be a thunderbolt in the film." "If Batman was twice as badass, then he might get halfway to where Dhanush is in this film," he added. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans feature in the film.

377.title: Some pap pics look vulgar, then people character assassinate you: Janhvi
377.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that sometimes photos taken by paparazzi can look vulgar because they are "taken at a certain angle" or she is "photographed in a certain way". "People perceive you in a certain way and they character assassinate you, even though you make choices based on your comfort. That bothers me," the actress said.

378.title: How does the ODI team rankings table read after India's series victory?
378.article_body: Following their 2-1 ODI series victory against England, India are placed third on the ICC ODI team rankings table. India have accumulated 109 rating points, while fourth-placed Pakistan have 106 rating points. England are currently second with 121 rating points, while New Zealand lead the rankings with 128 rating points.

379.title: Moosewala's father cries while unveiling his statue, says 'can't see son as statue at 28'
379.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh broke down while unveiling a 6.5 feet statue of his son in Punjab's Mansa recently. "I can't bear to see my son as a statue at 28. We wait for justice. The killers, whether sitting on foreign soil or here, should be punished," he said. Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead on May 29.

380.title: Delighted to win civic polls in Gwalior; BJP has crash-landed: Jairam Ramesh
380.article_body: After winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said, "Nothing has given me greater pleasure than the victory in Gwalior local body polls." "BJP has crash-landed there," Ramesh said. Notably, Gwalior and its nearby districts, including Guna, are considered as the family bastion of the Congress-turned BJP politician Jyotiraditya Scindia.

381.title: Emu runs on road, disrupts traffic in US' Texas; videos surface
381.article_body: Videos of an emu, a flightless bird, running loose on the road and disrupting traffic in Houston in US' Texas have surfaced online. According to local media, the emu was captured and returned to its owners safely. One of the videos of the incident showed three police cars following the emu as it walks on the streets in the area.

382.title: Rejected 'Judwaa 2', didn't want to do 'bachpan ka role': Siddharth Nigam
382.article_body: Actor Siddharth Nigam has revealed that he was offered to play Varun Dhawan's childhood character in the 2017 film 'Judwaa 2'. "I didn't want to do a 'bachpan ka role'. Otherwise, it becomes difficult to get roles as a male lead," he added. Siddharth further said he decided not to do "popular actors' bachpan ka role" after doing 'Dhoom 3'.

383.title: Tamil Nadu CM gets discharged from hospital, votes in Presidential poll
383.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was discharged from Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Monday after recovering from COVID-19 and went directly to the Secretariat complex to cast his vote in the Presidential poll. The ruling DMK and its allies are backing Opposition choice former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha. AIADMK is supporting Droupadi Murmu who is the nominee fielded by BJP.

384.title: School bus driver rapes 15-yr-old Dalit student in Pune, arrested
384.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a school bus driver for allegedly raping a 15-year-old Dalit student. According to police, accused contacted the girl on Saturday while she was attending tuition classes and later took her to a dilapidated building where he allegedly raped her. A case of rape has been filed under sections of IPC, POCSO Act and SC/ST Atrocities Act.

385.title: 2023 K'taka polls my last, won't contest from Chamundeshwari: Siddaramaiah
385.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has said that 2023 Assembly elections would be his last. "I'm making it very very clear...I will not contest from Chamundeshwari again," he added. "We will make someone a candidate, ensure that he or she wins, he or she will be a Congress candidate...I will contest from wherever I'm asked to," Siddaramaiah said.

386.title: Singers want to be like Arijit today, they're losing their identities: Mame
386.article_body: Folk artist Mame Khan has said that he doesn't want to become Arijit Singh. "Today, all singers want to be like him, and in the process, are losing their identities," he added. "I choose to maintain my voice, which is why it is valued. I also celebrate my folk roots; it's the strongest aspect [of my personality]," Mame further said.

387.title: Man who stole 50 tear gas canisters from Sri Lankan police arrested
387.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stealing 50 tear gas canisters from police during protests near Parliament in Sri Lanka's Colombo, according to media reports. The suspect, who was reportedly a mason, was arrested on Sunday from his residence, the police said. The suspect had stolen the canisters last week as security forces tried to disperse the protesters.

388.title: Rupee hits record low of 79.97 against US dollar
388.article_body: The rupee hit a record low of 79.97 against the US dollar on Monday after opening at 79.76. The Finance Ministry, while speaking about the matter said that global factors such as the Russia-Ukraine war, soaring crude oil prices and tightening of global financial conditions are the major reasons for the rupee's weakening.

389.title: ICSE Class 10 topper from Pune hears the news during a birthday party
389.article_body: The all-India ICSE Class 10 topper, Hargun Kaur Matharu from Pune, got the news about her achievement when she was celebrating her younger sister's birthday. Matharu, who scored 99.8% in the exam, is tied for the top position with three other students. She said she wants to appear for the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) and study coding.

390.title: No GST on pre-packed, labelled food items weighing over 25 kg: Finance Ministry
390.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that single packages of pre-packed and labelled food items like cereals and pulses weighing over 25 kg are exempt from 5% GST. It added that if a retail shopkeeper supplies an item in a loose quantity that was bought in a 25-kg pack from a manufacturer, its sale to the consumer will not attract GST.

391.title: History tells you Shaheen Afridi blew them away: Nasser on India's top-order
391.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said Team India's top-order batters struggle against left-arm pacers. "They need to play left-arm (pacers) a little bit better. History tells you that Shaheen Afridi blew them away one evening...And Reece Topley blew them away here (at Old Trafford)," he stated. Topley dismissed Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the final England ODI.

392.title: I have voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu: Cong MLA
392.article_body: Odisha Congress MLA Mohammed Moquim on Monday said that he has voted for NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "It's my personal decision as I have listened to my heart which guided me to do something for the soil and that's why [I] voted for her," he added. The Opposition has fielded Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the post.

393.title: Scindia chairs meet with heads of airline companies on safety issues
393.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a one-on-one meeting with heads of airline companies on Monday to review flight safety norms. The Aviation Ministry also issued instructions to each airline to take steps at all levels to enhance security surveillance. These steps come after a few Indian airlines reported back-to-back incidents of emergency landings due to technical issues.

394.title: Physio loses ₹1.17 lakh to fraudsters posing as army personnel
394.article_body: A physiotherapist was cheated of ₹1.17 lakh by fraudsters posing as army personnel saying 22 CISF personnel needed physiotherapy. The Borivali West-based physiotherapist received a call from a man posing as CISF Director General to approve payment. The victim opened payment mode in his digital wallet, entered the credit card number told by the fraudster and his own UPI pin.

395.title: Protest held against Sudan's military govt over tribal clashes
395.article_body: A protest was held in Sudan's capital Khartoum on Sunday against the military government over the tribal clashes in the Blue Nile province. Security forces used tear gas against the protesters as they marched towards the Presidential Palace. This comes as a senior health official said on Sunday that the death toll from the violence has risen to 65.

396.title: Who are the 4 students who jointly secured 1st rank in ICSE Class 10 exams?
396.article_body: Four students, including three girls, jointly secured the first rank in ICSE Class 10 exams, results for which were declared on Sunday. Hargun Kaur Matharu from Maharashtra's Pune, Pushkar Tripathi from UP's Balrampur, Anika Gupta from UP's Kanpur and Kanishka Mittal from UP's Kanpur all secured the first rank with 99.8% marks. The overall pass percentage for ICSE was 99.97%.

397.title: 22-yr-old female teacher kidnapped by gym trainer in UP's Gonda
397.article_body: A 22-year-old female teacher was allegedly kidnapped by a gym trainer in UP’s Gonda district in Nawabganj region. An FIR has been filed against the suspect, according to the police. Tej Pratap Singh, SHO of Nawabganj, said people saw the teacher travelling in an e-rickshaw on Sunday evening when an SUV approached and purportedly forced her to get inside car.

398.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris returning after collecting holy water die as bus hits bike
398.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris who were reportedly returning after collecting holy water as part of the yatra rituals, were killed after a bus allegedly rammed into the motorcycle that they were travelling on.  The deceased have been identified as Moradabad residents Rahul and Gaurav. Reports said that the two were immediately hospitalised but passed away while undergoing treatment.

399.title: Alt News' Zubair seeks urgent SC hearing to quash 6 FIRs against him
399.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair on Monday sought an urgent listing of his plea in the Supreme Court seeking to quash all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly outraging religious feelings. The fresh plea of Zubair has also challenged the constitution of the Special Investigation Team (SIT) by the state government to probe the six cases.

400.title: Only Delhi govt providing respite from inflation via its schemes: Kejriwal
400.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Delhi government is the only one that is providing any respite from growing inflation through its many schemes. "I demand the central government to take back GST applied on materials of everyday use of basic food products, it is not right," Kejriwal added.

401.title: Yashwant called Mulayam an ISI agent, can't support him: Shivpal
401.article_body: Amid ongoing voting for Presidential polls, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Yadav said that he can't back Yashwant Sinha as the latter had called Samajwadi Party (SP) patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav 'ISI agent'. "Hardcore SP leaders...who follow [Mulayamji's] principles [won't] support a candidate who levelled such allegations," he added. Notably, SP had extended support to Sinha.
